text: Winter. Silence on the forest floor. Snow falling. Then t sound of breathing. The soft footfall of a person running HANNA, fourteen years old, long hair, eyes like blue ice, glides through the trees, a bow strapped to her shoulder. is dressed in animal skins and fur shoes. She blends almo completely into the landscape of trees and snow. She stops dead. Her breath visible in the freezing air. Suddenly alert, she has spotted her prey. A REINDEER nuzz the snow, trying to unearth a patch of grass to eat. Its pops up - danger. Too late. The sudden swoosh and the sna an arrow piercing its skin. The deer flops to the ground with a thud. It whines, its dig at the earth. Its mouth gnaws at the icy air. Steam pouring from its nostrils. HANNA approaches, removes a fur glove. She bends to her knees. She reaches out and gently pets the animals frightened fa She runs her hand down along its neck, in towards the wou
I just missed your heart. She stands and pulls out an old pistol from her waist holster. She fires two shots directly at CAMERA.
A knife enters the deer near its anus.
Remove the penis and scrotum, make a deep, circular cut around the rectum. HANNA pulls the knife up towards the brisket.
Cut from the rear to the brisket. She works calmly without expression. 2.

The deer lies on it's side. HANNA breaths hard. She reaches deep into the body cavity and pulls out intestine, stomach, liver. She freezes, sensing danger. Her hand deep inside the animal. She listens. She looks o into the still forest. No sound. ERIK, mid forties, a mammoth with leathery face, stands behind her like a ghost.

You're dead. Right now. I've killed you. HANNA spins spraying deer-blood on to the snow and brings her fist right to ERIK's face. He blocks and thumps an op palm on to HANNA's shoulder sending her sprawling into th snow. She leaps to her feet, as ERIK aims a kick at her head. S dodges, punches below his knee cap, and goes for her pistol. ERIK slaps the hand away.

Use your hands! She goes for the gun again and again he stops her. He moves in tight, pulling the gun from its holster and tossing it deep into the forest. HANNA clips ERIK'S temple sending him to the ground. She wraps her arms around his neck preparing to snap... ... but she can't. He throws her over his shoulder into a pile of snow. ERIK stands and wipes the snow from his pants. His face s a touch of frustration. He plods into the forest.
Drag it back yourself. HANNA drags herself to the deer's side. She stares at its dead face. 3.
HANNA clears the kill site. Wipes the last dots of blood to a stick. No sign she was ever there.
HANNA drags the 200 lb deer on a makeshift sled. She lift her knees high and moves at a steady pace. Hidden among the trees, a little way off, ERIK is watchin her.
A log cabin built around an ancient tree surrounded by th thick forest. HANNA is standing in the snow, stripping th deer with a knife. It's a tough job but she does it no fu

Almost everything ERIK and HANNA own they've made themsel using what can be found in the forest. What few possessio that have been brought in from the outside world are old worn. HANNA is making a fire using a bow drill. The friction of drill produces an ember which HANNA carefully transfers t some dried leaves.
HANNA and ERIK sit either side of a small fire, still dre in furs. HANNA swirls a spoon around in a dish of stew. ERIK takes mouthful, watches HANNA not eating.
What's wrong? Are you hurt? She keeps swirling her spoon.
You were half asleep.
I'll do better next time.
German. 4.
(In German w/ English
I'll do better next time.
Italian.
(In Italian w/ English
I'll do better next time.
Spanish. HANNA studies her food and slowly takes a spoonful.
Spanish.
(In Spanish w/ English
Did you really want me to snap your neck? He looks at her - drops the quiz.
How much did you pull off the deer?
A hundred and twenty with scraps.
About 200 pounds in total? HANNA nods.
That explains it.
What?
How you beat me. You're getting strong. HANNA almost blushes. ERIK stands to put his bowl away.
(In Spanish w/ English
I'm glad you didn't snap my neck.
HANNA is in bed under fur covers listening while ERIK rea to her from an old encyclopedia.
The Great Blue Whale is the largest animal to have ever existed. A blue whale's tongue weighs over two and a half tons and its mouth is large enough to hold 90 tons of food and water.
How much is that?
It's bigger than the cabin. Its heart weighs thirteen hundred pounds and a male has seven gallons of testicles. HANNA smirks.
The Blue Whale's "music" can be heard for over 500 miles. He shuts the book.
Time for sleep.
Good night. He stands by her bed looking down at her.
Did you forget something?
No. ERIK takes HANNA'S gun out of his pocket and puts it on t table next to her bed.
Sorry.
Good night. He walks to the door. HANNA stops him with a question. 6.
What's music like?
It's difficult to explain.
Try. He opens the encyclopedia again, leafs through the pages reads.
a Music. A combination of sounds with a view to beauty of form and expression of emotion'.
But how does it feel? Erik is not equipped to answer such esoteric questions.
Good. It feels good. It's, uh, nice.
Tell me properly. Can you play music?
Your mother could. She used to sing very well.
I'd like to hear it for myself.
You will soon enough.
How soon? Erik looks away from her questioning eyes.
When you're ready.
I'm ready. I'm ready already. They look at each other- he weighs it up.

Just go to sleep now. I'll see you in the morning. 7. Hanna covers herself in an animal skin as ERIK pulls a wa screen across her bed, strokes her hair gently for a mome and leaves the room. HANNA reaches under her bed and takes out an old battered photograph, taken 15 years ago, of a YOUNG WOMAN with eye like hers - her MOTHER, JOANNA ZADEK.
The morning sunlight slants through the forest. ERIK is walking through the trees. He stops, raises his pistol at a tree trunk some distance away and fires. The tree breaks apart.
HANNA wakes with the sound of the GUNSHOT. She is still holding her mothers photgraph. HANNA pushes the photograph under her mattress and climbs of bed.
Another GUNSHOT breaks a tree apart. Hanna fires. Another tree breaks apart. She rolls and fires. She rolls and fires. She reloads. And fires. ERIK watching.
HANNA attacks ERIK. Hand. Knee. Elbow. Fist. He defends easily.
Again. They reset. She repeats the motion. Hand. Knee. Elbow. Fi
Again. Hand. Knee. Elbow. Fist. She's getting faster. Her strike are solid. 8.

A medium size log nailed along two pillars of the cabin acts as a chin-up bar. Erik and Hanna do chin-ups. Both are fit. Neither will gi up. ERIK observing HANNA's power. Both have the sense tha he is judging her. HANNA's face fiercely determined.
ERIK and HANNA sit with their backs to a tree in the huge forest as they breathlessly recover from the exhaustion o the exercise. HANNA speaks fast, reciting.

I live in Leipzig. German city. Population 0.7 Million people. We live at Number 7 Weissingerplatz. I go to school at the Klaus Kohle Gymnasium and my best friends are Rudi Gunter and Clara Schliess. I like literature and sport, in particular tennis and athletics. I have a dog called Trudi.
HANNA is running, racing ERIK. Fierce determination, almo anger in her eyes. They reach the river and dive in.
HANNA and ERIK are swimming hard against the current of t fast-flowing river, working at full pelt just to stay sti They swim and swim, their muscles busting, their lungs bursting.

Don't give up! Don't give up! HANNA's arms flails as she fights against the stream and screams in pain. She is grabbed under by the undertow and pulled downwards. For a second she is underwater and in darkness but ERIK's hand pulls her back up and she breaks surface with a gasp of relief.
On the bank, HANNA climbs out. ERIK approaches her but moodily, even angrily, she pushes him away.
I didn't need your help. 9. Her face sullen, she walks away into the forest. He stare after her.
Outside, ERIK stands alone, thinking. An OWL swoops down catch a mouse then flies back up into the tree tops.

HANNA is asleep. ERIK enters the room. ERIK approaches the bed, and solemnly takes out a pistol aims it at HANNA. He is tense with expectation. Suddenly HANNA bursts from her covers, smashes the pistol from ERIK's hand and smashes him down on to the bed. She grabs the pistol and points it at his face. She is alert, eyes intense, face proud. She speaks quietly.
I'm ready now.

Maybe. ERIK relaxes. It's a false beat. He lunges again at her, really violently. He seems to be really trying to hurt her. But HANNA has reached under her mattress and there is a f knife - in an instant it is at ERIK's neck. She pricks hi neck slightly. It bleeds just slightly. Stillness and silence. HANNA breathless, angry.
You didn't tell me you had a knife.
You told me to think for myself. Isn't that what you want? She is angry for the first time. ERIK does not answer. Ju stares at her.
I want to see things. I can't stay here forever. 10.
ERIK takes long lunging strides straight out from the cab He counts his paces.
One, two, three, four...
ERIK and HANNA are racing through the forest. Over this we continue to hear ERIK counting his paces fro the previous scene.
...five, six, seven, eight...

...nine, ten. After 10 paces, ERIK makes a 90 degree turn and enters th tree line. The snow and mud crunch under his boots. We continue to inter-cut the following with more close-up HANNA training: climbing, fighting, chin-ups, shooting. A the while we continue to hear ERIK counting out his paces After 40 paces, with the cabin light distant, ERIK falls his knees. He unsheathes a large knife and jams it into t frozen earth.

HANNA comes out of the cabin, rubbing her eyes and yawnin eating a hunk of cold meat. She looks up to see a snow fox staring at her from the tr line. She crouches and holds out what's left of her breakfast. The fox approaches gingerly, delicately.

Hello little foxy... foxy loxy... come on... come and share my breakfast. The fox comes to her and nervously accepts the scrap, withdrawing a few feet to eat it. HANNA shuffles forward carefully and gently pats the snow fox - it is only a cub 11. As the fox eats it makes low grunting noises which HANNA expertly mimics - causing the fox to look up, puzzled - t seem to have a genuine connection - as if they've done th before. Suddenly the snow fox freezes, pricks up its ears, looks HANNA looks up too. An aeroplane is approaching overhead. The fox darts back the undergrowth as the roar of the plane reverberates thr the forest. HANNA jumps to her feet and with incredible speed and dexterity climbs to the very top of a near by tree. The p roars over her head and disappears over the snowy wildern oblivious to HANNA'S tiny presence. It's only now that we see the full extent of HANNA'S isolation.
HANNA enters breathless with excitement. ERIK sits pensiv with his back to the door.
Did you see it? Wasn't it beautiful, like thunder. I had to stick my fingers in my ears it was so loud. Did you hear it? She stops, sensing ERIK'S mood.
What's wrong? Sitting in front of ERIK is a metal case, caked with froz dirt. ERIK pops open the case. Inside a tangle of technol HANNA looks at the case, mesmerized.
What does it do?
It tells Marissa Wiegler where we are. He looks at her, a hint of a challenge.
When you want to leave here all you have to do is flip that switch. She approaches the box and places a single finger on the small red switch. 12.
But once it's done, there'll be no going back. She'll never give up until you're dead, or she is. You understand? I wont be there to hold your hand. So be sure. Be sure it's what you really want.
You're not scaring me. He looks at her disbelievingly. She shakes her head in protest, but simultaneously moves from the switch. He softens towards her.
It's here. There's no rush. Take your time. HANNA turns her back on the box, but can't help taking another look at it over her shoulder.
HANNA is under the covers again while ERIK reads more fro the encyclopedia.

Laika, a mongrel dog from the streets of Moscow, was the first animal to orbit the Earth. She was launched into outer space on the third of November, 1957. Scientists believed humans would be unable to survive conditions of outer space, so flights by animals were viewed as an experimental precursor to human missions. Her rocket was not designed to be retrievable, and Laika had always been intended to die.
That's sad. ERIK awkwardly turns the page to change subject.
When a star collapses the supernova explosion is 10 billion times brighter than other stars. HANNA shuts her eyes and tries to imagine how bright that might be. 13.
ERIK straps the bow to his chest and grabs a quiver of bo
Will you hunt with me? Hanna is sweeping the ground.
If you want.
It's up to you.
Me?
Yes. HANNA eyes the box sitting open, it's waiting for her.
I'll stay.
Fine. ERIK leaves abruptly. HANNA continues to sweep the ground, her movements bring closer to the metal box. She stops sweeping and looks at box. She turns and walks out of the cabin.
HANNA comes out of the cabin and sits down on a tree trun She sees the snow fox cub but says nothing. It comes over noses around the cabin, but HANNA'S mind is elsewhere.
(whispering to herself) Marissa Wiegler.
CLOSE ON - the metal box, the switch catches the light fr the door as HANNA enters to confront it. The room is stil and quiet. HANNA approaches the metal box and slowly reaches out her hand. 14.
Come and find me. CLOSE ON - She flips the switch, a little red light begin flash. An ALARM CLOCK begins to ring as we cut to -

CLOSE ON - a bedside alarm clock ringing loudly. MARISSA WIEGLER, a handsome woman in her mid-40's with re hair, reaches over and slams the alarm clock off. She's alone in her bed. She always is. She has no childre She's made choices in her life and lives without looking back. She walks into her ensuite bathroom and looks at herself the mirror. She collects her toothbrush and bares her tee in a snarl as she brushes them. Her gums bleed a little.

HANNA tends to boiling pots. She's cooking a feast. ERIK enters. He stamps his feet shedding ice at the door. He walks by the box and sees the little red light flicker on. HANNA sees this and sees him smile, but she knows he' sad.
You were lucky to grab that deer. There was nothing out there today. ERIK looks over at the meal HANNA is preparing.
Smells good. He wraps an arm around her shoulder. They don't hug much it shows. HANNA is almost defensive and tense. And then t hug is over.

MARISSA, wearing a sharp business suit, drives a black Ac into her designated spot in the CIA HQ's car park. As she gets out, we see the parking space is designated f MARISSA WIEGLER. Her young male PA and TECH ONE are already waiting for he 15.
Ma'am. We've had a signal reported by Interpol. We think it's Eric Heller. An unusual expression of shock on MARISSA'S face.
Well I'll be.
It seems he's in Sweden. Jokkmokk. 40 miles out.
What the fuck is he doing there?
Living in the middle of nowhere, like the frigging Una Bomber.
The son of a bitch. Sweden? Sweden?! The PA hands her a coffee and she hands him some files.
Apparently he turned on his locator.
He's not an idiot.
I know... I mean I believe so. But that's what happened.
After 14 years in Jokkmokk, maybe he'd rather go to prison.
ERIK is leaning over a pail of water, cutting his beard o with a knife.

Eric Heller. From the Czech Republic. I recruited him in 1991 when they were all joining the Velvet Revolution and sticking it to the commies ERIK, now clean shaven, opens a wooden case in the corner the room and takes out an old folded three piece suit and rolled shirt. 16.
He couldn't wait to kiss some yankee butt and make some bucks doing our dirty work. ERIK awkwardly begins to change into the suit.
MARISSA sits in a video conference room surrounded by wor looking faces, with her are her close advisors WALT and B She's also speaking into a microphone on the table in fro of her.

Trouble was he had his own way of doing things. Kinda paranoid. WALT fires up a computer screen and logs on. He uses an access code. This takes him to a new file. He enters the tracking device number. A name comes up. ERIK HELLER. He clicks on a link. HELLER's face pops on to the screen.

Not a team player. Not a ajoiner.a He became increasingly isolated and disturbed. Kept mouthing off about classified programmes. WALT clicks on a link to a newspaper article which comes to the screen: The headline: POLICE HUNT FOR MURDER SUSPE A picture of Heller in the article and a smashed car on a rural road. The two men stare at his face.

I kept warning and he kept getting worse. In the summer of 1995 he took his girlfriend, Johanna Zadek, on a trip to the Baltic coast and blew her head off. WALT hits a new link: A still of the same young woman as photo HANNA was previously looking at in her bedroom. Her name printed below it: JOHANNA ZADEK.
Never heard from him again.
Anybody know why?
Maybe the pressure got to him, Bob. You know what that's like. 17. A MALE VOICE comes from the speaker, this is LEWIS but we don't see him yet.
What do you want us to do?
Bring him in.
What do you mean? Call the police,
- Walt. This is exactly the kind of shit we can't have out there anymore. He was one of ours, we trained him. He kills some other poor woman and it's a cluster fuck.
Tell it to Interpol. Let them pick him up. Try him for murder.
He's right. This has nothing to do with us. I don't understand.
You don't have to. I'm making the call. BOB and WALT exchange a look.
Thank you, Gentlemen. That'll be all. The video screen flickers off, people take their files an start to leave. MARISSA WIEGLER stands in the darkness.

HANNA sits in her bed reading her encyclopaedia. ERIK, dressed incongruously in the suit and tie, enters a sits on the edge of her bed. She doesn't look up from her book. His face shows more emotion than we've seen before.
Hanna... HANNA looks up, still trying to hide her fear.
Tell me again? 18.
Marissa Weigler.
Then?
Postcard.
Then?
What?
The address where we meet.
Wilhelm Grimm's house. Stephanstrasse 260. 10559, Berlin. Germany. ERIK moves a strand of hair from HANNA'S forehead and loo at her with paternal care.
Good night my sweet girl. He stands and quietly goes to the door when her voice sto him.
Father... He turns to look at her, both their eyes full of trepidat
You can do this. You're ready. Just remember what I've taught you. She smiles reassuringly at him.
I'll see you there.
ERIK comes out of the cabin carrying a small rucksack. He closes the door behind him and takes a deep breath.
HANNA gets out of bed and goes to the small window. 19. She watches as ERIK walks away from the cabin for the las time.

location: EDGE OF NORTH SWEDISH FOREST. NIGHT. 38

text: Dusk in the forest as the flickering sun goes down. As peaceful a place as you could imagine. A calm blueness of impending night on the snow. Then a series of ropes break the top frame and FIFTY US SPECIAL FORCES dressed in white snow gear silently abseil down to the ground.
HANNA is doing push-ups on her bedroom floor.
Infra-red POV as the SPECIAL OPS TEAM head through the fo wearing night vision-goggles. The Leader of the Operation follows the tracker signal.
Is this guy one of ours?

Used to be. Tread carefully, he's been in there a long time, he's damaged goods, and he knows we're coming. We see through the infra-red vision the endless trees in pitch blackness. The SPECIAL OPS FORCES get closer. They see the cabin in night. They approach. Silence in the darkness. Just the breathing of men in the icy cold.

HANNA stops her push-ups, sensing the SPECIAL FORCES approach. She silently springs to her feet and moves to the front o the cabin. She looks out and sees shadows moving among the trees. She turns and presses herself against the wall. 20.

The HEAD OF OPS waves TWO SPECIAL OPERATIVES forward. The rest of the forces surround the cabin, but at a distance. The two men approach the cabin. One opens the door and th other steps in. Then the first follows close behind. Both engulfed by darkness. The rest of the forces wait in silence for a radio signal The HEAD of SPECIAL OPS looses patience and picks up the radio.
McCullum? Do you read me? No response.
I repeat, do you read me? The HEAD of OPS waves all thirty of his men closer to the cabin. Guns at the ready. The HEAD of OPS and five other men storm the cabin.

Through night vision we see the cabin interior. Then the SPECIAL FORCES, dead on the floor. Necks broken. Then find HANNA sitting quietly, looking timid and unsure Just a little girl, her eyes shining in the dark.
MARISSA is walking through long concrete corridor as her phone rings. She answers quickly.
What is it?
Ma'am, this is Lewis. MARISSA affects a abusiness as usuala tone.
Go ahead.
The target escaped.
How did that happen? 21.
We're thinking maybe he got away in the snow, in the thick snow, or... But he's in the wind and I have two men down.
Find him, Lewis. Find him and take him out.
Ma'am. There's more. They found a child, his daughter. MARISSA turns pale.
A cement box. HANNA lies on a small bed. Not moving. Two American voices.
She hasn't moved since we brought her in.
Has anyone talked to her?
They want a psych evaluation before they interrogate.
HANNA lies on the cot. She's been cleaned up and is weari an army regulation jump suit. The metal door drags open. Doctor, BURTON, closes the door behind him. He walks up t HANNA.
Hello Hanna. Hanna lies motionless.
My name is Dr. Burton. Would you like to talk to me? BURTON'S voice has been trained to engender a state of pe and security. HANNA sits up and hangs her legs off the si of the cot. 22.
I was told by my father to gain the upper hand.
Really. Interesting. What else did your father tell you?
Where am I?
You're in holding.
I see.

This must all be very strange for you. You've been in the forest a long time. But I want you to know no one's going to hurt you. We just want to talk to you about your father. HANNA seems to be staring up at the ceiling.
Hanna? He follows her eye-line to the CCTV camera above them.
Is that a camera?
Ah, yes, that's a camera. To keep a record.
Camera obscura, it's Latin for "dark chamber".
LEWIS sits with the MONITOR, watching HANNA watching him.
Plug the CCTV through to Langley. Extension 247. MONITOR presses some buttons as LEWIS calls on his phone speaks into it.
You should have visual on the psych evaluation now. 23.

location: OBS ROOM. LANGLEY HQ. NIGHT. CONT. 48

text: MARISSA, alone in a Langley OBS ROOM. No one else there. at night in America. Something secret about Marissa here. On the screen she sees HANNA in the Interrogation Room. H screen tells she is watching CAMP G - Interrogation Room MARISSA watches HANNA intently.
It was first described by the Arabic scientist Ibn Alhazen in the year 1021.
What's she saying?
Gobbledygook.

location: OBS ROOM. LANGLEY HQ. NIGHT. CONT. 49

text: MARISSA stares at her screen, at the blank face of the fourteen year old HANNA. Focus in on MARISSA's face as sh studies this strange young woman. The sense that MARISSA knows more about this girl than she is letting on. On the screen BURTON continues to probe.
Can I get you something? What do you like? Music? Magazines? Just say. Anything at all.
HANNA leans forward. Looks at BURTON, who encourages her his eyes. She whispers.
I want to speak to Marissa Wiegler.
MARISSA sits in stunned silence.
Did you hear that? MARISSA pauses before she answers.
Tell her I'll be there tonight. 24.
But...
Just do it.

A white space with specialist lighting and the hum of specialised air pressurizes. A protected environment - th is the DNA lab. A MILITARY DOCTOR is looking at the resul something on a computer. It has shocked and intrigued him calls across to another doctor.
John come and take a look at this kid's blood sample. MILITARY DOCTOR 2 walks across. He sees the sample on the screen. MILITARY DOCTOR 2. Is that right? That can't be right.
And I got a sample of her hair. MILITARY DOCTOR 2 looks at the results, baffled.
That must be contamination.
What contamination? What would it be?
Run it again.
HANNA is sitting on her cot with her back against the wal A metal door drags open. A pair of smart female shoes enter the room, accompanied the military boots of two guards.

My name is Marissa Wiegler. You wanted to speak to me? HANNA turns to look. It is a completely different woman, dressed in similar clothes to MARISSA but not her. 25. HANNA stares at her, then looks at the two guards.
(to the guards) You can wait outside. The guards exit and the door slams shut behind them.

location: CAMP G. OBSERVATION ROOM. DAY. CONT. 54

text: In the Observation Room LEWIS is looking at a small Monit He speaks into a consoles microphone.
You should have visual.

location: CIA LANGLEY OPERATIONAL HQ. EARLY DAWN. CONT. 55

text: MARISSA WIEGLER sits alone in the empty CIA Langley headquarters, watching the CCTV relay.
Where am I?
HANNA stares at FALSE MARISSA awaiting an answer.
You're in a safe place. Let's talk about your father. You must love him very much.
Where did you meet him? The false MARISSA pauses.
MARISSA hears the question. Thinks fast, her mind totally focussed.
Tell her it was by a news kiosk in Alexanderplatz, East Berlin. Say it was raining.
FALSE MARISSA pauses looking at HANNA. We see that she ha tiny microphone in her ear. 26.
At a news kiosk. Alexanderplatz. In the rain. She smiles reassuringly. HANNA nods, looking at FALSE MARISSA.
LEWIS watches on the screen. But then gets a call from th Military Laboratory.
Lewis.
Sir we need to talk to you. We've run tests on the girl. His voice sounds urgent, concerned. But Marissa has interrupted.
What tests? As the argument continues, we see and hear on the screen FALSE MARISSA continuing to talk to HANNA.
Do you know where your father is? In the OBS room LEWIS, half watching the screen, explains MARISSA on intercom.
Standard DNA and meds.
MARISSA, alone in Langley, suddenly alert.
Send the results straight to me. On the screen FALSE MARISSA is talking to HANNA.
Did he tell you where he was going? We're all worried about him. On the CCTV Hanna looks at the FALSE MARISSA. She begins cry, holds out her arms to be held. 27.
The MONITOR sees her cry and turns to LEWIS who is still embroiled in the tests discussion.
Sir look. LEWIS looks at HANNA.
The FALSE MARISSA tentatively takes HANNA in her arms.

It's OK. It's OK. HANNA coils her thin arms around the FALSE MARISSA'S neck clinging to her like a monkey. The FALSE MARISSA looks up to the security camera, slight concerned. Hanna wriggles in her arms, to get a better grip...
MARISSA watches this strange image of her false self hugg this young girl. HANNA begins to weep more and more, burrowing her face into the FALSE MARISSA. On the CCTV we hear.
You want me to give her something?
HANNA clutching on to FALSE MARISSA, nestles close, weepi
I think it might be necessary.
MARISSA watches, now concerned. Something is wrong.
Get her out of there.
Burton comes rushing down the corridor filling a syringe he goes. He arrives at HANNA'S door. 28.
Open up. The first guard opens HANNA'S door.
Abort. I repeat. Abort.
Hanna hugs, weeping, on to the FALSE MARISSA. BURTON hear the instruction to abort but too late... ...as suddenly and with total efficiency HANNA SNAPS the FALSE MARISSA's neck.

MARISSA stares in shock as her false self slumps dead to floor. Then she watches as HANNA grabs the first GUARDS handgun from his holster and fires two rounds into Burton skull. And two more into the first GUARD's chest.
LEWIS immediately presses the Alarm Bell.
Jee-sus wept! On another screen LEWIS watches as the other Guard tries drag the metal door shut. He hits a fleshy door jam - Bur Hanna is upon him. Two shots.
MARISSA watches HANNA aim straight at camera. HANNA'S fie eyes looking at her, MARISSA cant help but pull away from screen. HANNA fires and the screen goes blank.
LEWIS watches as, one after another, his camera's go down But still there's no sign of HANNA.
She's a child for Christsake!

location: CAMP G. CORRIDOR IN SECURE BRIEFING AREA. 72

text: Alarms are sounding and red lights flashing in the corrid 29. HANNA walks fast along the corridor. She ducks into a doo avoid two Centre Guards running past, dives down another corridor and walks through a pair of double doors with warning signs on them. PROTECTED ENVIRONMENT - CLASSIFIED PROGRAMME.

She finds herself in the specialist Military DNA Laborato The MILITARY DOCTORS stare at her. One of them reaches fo alarm but HANNA is too fast. She flies across the desk an smashing a glass test tube, she cuts the doctor's neck, t turns and does the same to the other one. HANNA looks round, trying to find a way out. Then she see something on the desk. It is a file with a photo of herse clipped to it and a collection of papers - she scans it a reads in several places the letters aDNA.a But before she has time to read properly, she hears a fem voice from outside the lab.

This is Sanders. I'm checking Zone eleven. The FEMALE GUARD radios off, then enters. She senses something. POV SANDERS - The DNA laboratory suddenly seems empty. Th buzz of the lab's lighting and the whir of the air- pressurizes are the only sounds as the GUARD looks around Then the GUARD hears a rustling from behind her and tense up. She turns around but HANNA has vanished into thin air, th is silence.

location: CAMP G. CORRIDOR IN SECURE BRIEFING CENTRE. 74

text: HANNA, runs along the corridor. She has in her hands the results which she scrunches up and jams into a pocket.

location: CAMP G. AIR-CONDITIONING DUCT ABOVE CORRIDOR. CON

text: HANNA eyes the vent above her. She peers around a corner her only other route of escape and sees:

MILITARY PERSONNEL reach the intersection close to HANNA spread out, all going in different directions but none co towards her. 30. The last pair of personnel start heading towards her. She looks up at the duct again and a length of ducting along wall, about waist height. She puts a foot on a rail, halls herself up towards the v She fiddles with the vent, eventually opening it as the personnel are almost upon her.
She crawls through the narrow air-conditioning duct. She stops, alert to the sounds beneath her. Through small perforations in a vent she sees more MILITARY PERSONNEL running down the corridor.

location: CAMP G. AIR-CONDITIONING DUCT ABOVE CORRIDOR. CON

text: The duct bends to a vertical angle. She begins to crawl u steep gradient towards a crack of light.
LEWIS sits in silence. MONITOR looks at him nervously.
You think she's out?
She can't get out. LEWIS picks up an internal telephone.
Who's on the perimeter? Detail every unit available.

HANNA is sweating, exhausted, blinking in the darkness, trying to make out what the light source is. The gradient has got steeper and she starts to slide backwards on the smooth metal surface. She digs her finge into the rivets joining the plates of stainless steel, tr to get a purchase. She summons the last of her strength and reaches a crest. rests a moment, then hauls herself over the crest and immediately starts sliding... she tumbles, gathering pace falling down a long chute into the blackness. She has no where she is or what's happening, but she's covering a lo ground. 31. She hits the bottom with a crunch and cries out. When she opens her eyes she sees more tunnel - and at the light. She crawls quickly towards it and stops at a kind manhole cover with a sprung lever - she wrenches the leve and pushes against it. After a little effort the cover gi way and light floods in, blinding her. HANNA recovers and tentatively pokes her head out into:

BLAZING SUN - HANNA's pale face appears, eyes crinkled sh Wider - HANNA emerges from a hole in the ground in the mi of a sandblasted desert and slams the cover closed. Total silence now, except for the whistle of the wind on sand. takes her eyes a moment to adjust to the blinding light. Blearily she looks out across this alien environment. After a moment her ears prick up. She turns just in time see a column of Military Jeeps rise over a sand dune in t distance behind her. The jeeps are crawling straight towa her, ominously shimmering in the desert heat. She quickly ducks back down into her rabbit hole and waits.
In the middle of the desert the soldiers convene, looking HANNA. A military truck is stationery. Nothing around for miles. We hear a military voice on a radio.
473 are you receiving me? Can you confirm your position. Subject has escaped.

The truck moves off a short distance and stops again. Meanwhile a large convoy of Military Vehicles passes righ over HANNA. When it has past she sees the first vehicle crawling to a halt right near the hole - just yards away. One of the MILITARY PERSONNEL in the jeep gets out and go over to the hole, lifts the lid, inspects the darkness. The Truck radio is on and we hear the voice.

Can you confirm your position 473? Banks? Banks can you hear me? 32. Once BANKS is satisfied he walks away a few paces, gets o pair of high powered binoculars, looks this way and that. He walks up a dune and scans the dunes with his binocular Finally he walks back and climbs into the Jeep, gets on t radio. BANKS. I'm at a perimeter opening at the far east wing. Something's not quite right... He doesn't notice but the lid is open now and the air- conditioning duct is empty.

As the Jeep moves off we see HANNA is clinging to the axl hanging upside down underneath. Her face is pressed to th oily metal, her back just an inch from the desert floor flashing beneath her. The jeeps now take a track along the edge of a steep dune HANNA takes her chance and lets go of her grip. She clenc her eyes shut as the jeep passes over her. As soon as the jeeps clears she rolls herself over the edge of the dune. HANNA rolls down the sand dune at speed until finally she slows and stops. She lies still and shocked by the quiet the Jeep disappears into the distance. Then she sits up a looks around herself. She has no conception of this landscape, no idea where she might be.

MARISSA moves between her wardrobe and a suitcase packing clothes, underwear, another power suit. Fully packed she goes to the back of the wardrobe and pul aside some dresses to reveal a hidden safe. She keys in t security code, the safe door opens and from the back of t safe Marissa retrieves a blue file. MARISSA looks at the files title in large blunt letters: GALINKA.

FLASHBACK to 1995. A much younger MARISSA watching a very fast-moving car on deserted forest road. She takes from her pocket a small detonating device and as the car approaches a bend, press it. 33. There is a small explosion and the car swerves off the ro and smashes headlong into a post. The horn starts to blar MARISSA approaches the car. The road is empty. MARISSA lo through binoculars at the car. She sees a woman, on the passenger side, head thrust forw JOHANNA ZADEK. Blood everywhere. MARISSA shoots her in th head just to be sure. But the driver's seat is empty. MAR stops dead. Then the back door opens on the other side. A man, a youn ERIK HELLER crawls out. He is holding a two year old chil his hands. The child's coat is covered in blood. MARISSA stares at the shocked child and takes the rifle t her eye to shoot again. As she does, ERIK senses her move and throws himself to the ground. Through the rifle viewfinder we see just a glimpse of ERI and the red glare of the coat covered in blood, ERIK HELL grabbing the child and sprinting for the forest, MARISSA taking aim at HELLER, and then firing as HELLER d into the forest.

MARISSA puts on a pair of rubber kitchen gloves and sets to the file in the sink. When it's all burnt up she switches on the garbage dispos and pushes the ashen remains down the gurgler with a dish mop.

The sun has dipped a little now, the shadows of the dunes longer, but the heat is still intense. HANNA's throat is parched by the dry heat, her pale eyes scorched by the angry sun. She walks purposefully but wit growing awareness of her tiny scale in this seemingly end sea of sand. She has no conception of this landscape, no where she might be.

I live in Leipzig. German city... 0.7 Million people... I go to school at the Klaus Kohle Gymnasium... literature and sport... I have a dog called Trudi. 34. HANNA climbs a steep dune, eyes down, feet pounding. A sh falls across her path and she looks up to see the shape o GIRL standing at the top of the dune silhouetted by the s HANNA's hand goes to the concealed gun. The GIRL stares at HANNA. They must be about the same age but there the resemblance ends. HANNA, dusty, bloodied an bruised in military top, trousers and boots stares at thi perfect image of western adolescence. Dressed head to toe in pink and drinking a can of coke, no concession to wher she is whatsoever. This is SOPHIE LYALL.
Hello. HANNA stares at her, then abruptly turns to walk in oppos direction until she sees another convoy of US military tr in the distance.
All right? HANNA turns back. Looks at SOPHIE. Like a wary animal.
Don't you speak English? HANNA is unsure how to speak to this strange person.

That can't be helped. You look terrible. At that moment SOPHIE'S brother, MILES, eight years old, rises over the dune and stands by SOPHIE'S side. In his h is a stills camera, not digital, film. MILES stares at HA while talking to SOPHIE.
Who's she?
I don't know. I just found her.
What's her name?
She can't talk.
Hanna.
She talked. 35.

I live in Leipzig. German city. Population 0.7 Million people. We live at Number 7 Weissingerplatz. I go to school at the Klaus Kohle Gymnasium and my best friends are Rudi Gunter and Clara Schliess. I like literature and sport, in particular tennis and athletics.
She's weird.
I also have a dog called Trudi.
We had a dog called Vincent, but he went mad and died.
I'm Sophie and this is my brother, Shit for Brains. From over the dune comes the voice of SOPHIE and MILES'S mother, RACHEL LYALL.
Come on, Sophie! We'll miss the light. MILES raises his camera to his eye and snaps a picture of HANNA.
Bye.
See you. SOPHIE takes one more puzzled look at HANNA, then turns a disappears over the sand dune. HANNA rises to the top of the dune. SOPHIE turns back to HANNA.
Do you need a lift somewhere?
No. I prefer to walk.

Suit yourself. 36. SOPHIE and MILES head back towards their nouveau hippy parents, RACHEL and SEBASTIAN LYALL who are waiting for t beside an old VAN parked by a tarmac road that cuts strai through the desert.
MARISSA sitting in first class, trying to hide the fact t she's on her cell phone mid-flight. There's turbulence.
She's in the desert east of Essouiara.
Have you got the DNA results?
We can't find them. It's possible she has them on her. Marissa takes that in.
Okay. I want you to focus on Erik Heller.
Why? A sweet-faced male AIR STEWARD hovers over MARISSA.
Excuse Madame, airline regulations state that -
I'm in conference.
All the same -
Back off, honey. I'm busy. MARISSA'S response is so fierce that the AIR STEWARD instinctively does as he's told.
You know this isn't going to go away.
I'm dealing with it Lewis. 37.
Okay but I just want you to admit - my Lord - how did she know to ask for you? She hangs up.

HANNA walking along the side of a tarmac desert road, approaching a dusty oasis town. HANNA enters the outskirts, teaming with scooters, trucks taxis, mules and goats. The impact knocks HANNA backwards assailed by the smells of dried fruit, meat tagines, cous cooking at market stalls, fresh fish and meat, still bloo and twitching, hanging in the sun for the flies. She list to the babble of Arabic, her ears, nose and eyes sensitiv every conversation and twitch of life. It all overpowerin exotic and visceral to her. An old broken-backed woman inches her way to market. HANN stares at her in astonishment. Her wrinkled skin. She eyes the abundance of animals - animals she's never s before in her life: Chickens. Goats. A camel, which Hanna finds bizarre and hilarious.

HANNA finds a stall with simple cotton clothing. She choo some cheap clothes and unseen goes around the back of the stall. She changes out of her ragged old clothes into her clothes. HANNA sees MILES running through the crowds carrying a ba cherries. She follows him a little way, onto a busy street with hot and cheap jewellery stores. He runs up the steps and enters a small mid-range hotel. HANNA looks up at the hotel, then enters.
HANNA stands at the reception desk. A kindly looking HOTE OWNER is eating a jammy biscuit. He's a little confused b HANNA.
Where's your family? 38.
Are you Arab?
I'm Moroccan.
Morocco. Capital city Rabat. Places of interest. Marrakesh. Essouaira. Religion Islam. Language Arabic (in Arabic w/ English
I like Arabic very much. It's like Japanese. It's big. The HOTEL OWNER nearly spits out his biscuit in shock.
(in Arabic w/ English
You speak Arabic?
(in Arabic w/ English
Yes, of course.
(in Arabic w/ English
Where's your family?
(in Arabic w/ English
I need a room for one night. Can you help? I don't have any money.
The HOTEL OWNER leads HANNA into a simple whitewashed hot room with twin beds. They speak in Arabic with English subtitles.
It's the best we've got.
Thank you. HANNA stares at the light switch.
Do you have one of these in every room? 39.
Of course. All mod cons.
It's electricity? The HOTEL OWNER looks at HANNA askance.
Yes.
I know a little bit about electricity. They say Edison discovered it, or was it Franklin?
Some American, I'm sure. He picks up an electric kettle.

Electric kettle for the English - they like to make their own tea. He switches it on, Hanna stares as it heats up noisily. He goes to a small wall mounted TV, switches it on for he fuzzy, terrible picture of an Arabic TV show. HANNA is fascinated, doesn't take her eyes off the TV as she sits the edge of the bed.
What is it?
It's the best we can do. She stares at the picture, bemused.
Where do you come from? Distracted, HANNA is caught off guard.

The forest. The HOTEL OWNER smiles, himself a little puzzled by this strange encounter, and leaves. She just sits there staring at the TV as it's volume seem increase. Meanwhile the electric kettle begins to boil. Steam pours from its spout and the whole contraption starts to rattle violently. 40. HANNA gets up and approaches the kettle very warily. She tries the light switch in an attempt to stop the kettle, it keeps boiling and making its strange rattle. HANNA tri another switch, the ceiling fan begins to turn, confusing HANNA even more. On the TV the news shows footage of war in the Middle Eas the sound of gunfire. The ceiling fan is at its top speed, it's blades cut the like a helicopter. A telephone beside the bed starts to ring. Combined the noises rise to a terrifying crescendo. HANNA backs away towards the bathroom. She stumbles and f through the bathroom door straight into the shower, inadvertently turning the taps on. Water pours down on he HANNA springs up and turns to face the stream of water as it were an attacker. She runs back into the bedroom. In the bedroom the kettle is still having a violent tantr the TV is still screaming, the fan still cutting, the pho still shouting. HANNA pulls at the exit door, but doesn't know to turn th handle. She panics. Smashes at the door. Eventually she f through the door and into the corridor.
Silence as HANNA sits on the corridor floor catching her breath. A little way down the corridor MILES and SOPHIE emerge fr their bedroom.
Look. It's that girl. He nudges SOPHIE. HANNA eyes them suspiciously.
Hey you made it.
Hey, again.
Did you walk here?
She looks different. 41.
Do you want to hang with us?
Are you hungry?
Miles is always hungry.
I'm thirsty.

The Reeperbaln, the main street of Hamburg's red light district. Tough and unglamorous. MARISSA WIEGLER gets out a taxi, checks the sign of the strip club and crosses the road. She is on the phone and we hear.
The Swedish borders are sealed. I have Swedish, Norwegian and Danish border patrols on high alert and Interpol have briefed the police.

I don't want any bad news Lewis. Neither of us can afford a fuck up. MARISSA hangs up. She enters a converted car park which i now a lap dancing bar. It's early in the day and the patr are as scarce as the clothes on the dancers. At the far end of the room is the reason Marissa is there MICHAEL ISAACS. Mid fifties. Rumpled suit, bleary, unshav and drinking a scotch. ISAACS smiles coldly at MARISSA.
I didn't think they let women in here.
They let them in, they just don't let them get dressed. He smiles, drinks, she eyes the scotch.
Still drinking on the job. You haven't changed.
You have. 42.
Adapt or die.
You want a drink?
I'll wait until I really need one. He grins and drinks. She sits, with a sigh, looks him in eye.
Erik Heller's still alive. ISAACS glances up from his drink.
You don't say.
There's more. MARISSA passes him a newspaper. He opens it. Hidden insid a picture of Hanna. He looks it over, surprised.
Wow. All grown up.
He did a good job.
Did she turn out like you hoped?
She just tried to kill me.
Isn't it always the way?
The fuck does that mean?
You bring them into this world, teach them how to kill and maim... and then they turn against you.
I didn't teach her.
No, it's better than that. You bred her from a test tube. MARISSA turns to the BARMAN and signals for a round of th scotches, aTwo of these...a 43.
Here's the problem: She thinks we killed her mother. He smiles wryly.
Just get her sectioned or something.
Sure, just as soon as she's done breaking peoples necks. You get her sectioned, if you can catch her. The drinks arrive, MARISSA drinks.
Right now she's in Morocco but she'll be trying to get out of the country. Find her and bring her to me. Quietly.
I'll need funds. MARISSA slides an envelope of bills across the table.

Don't spend it all on candy. She glances meaningfully at the STRIPPERS, who have been eyeing up ISAACS as a potential mark. ISAACS looks at the money. When he looks back up MARISSA already walking out the door.

HANNA is sitting at a table with the FAMILY who are all eating falafel while HANNA eats meat. SOPHIE and MILES parents, RACHEL and SEB, have some difficulty relating to their daughters attitudes. They be to a generation of counter cultural radicals whose priori have, over the past decade, shifted and they're now tryin assimilate into mainstream society whilst still holding o their ideals of autonomy and social liberation. SOPHIE is describing a recent cultural phenomenon while s picks at her food.
She's beautiful. I wish I had a body like hers. She's really cool too. She's married to a footballer and really loves him - 44. Meanwhile HANNA eyes the crowd, constantly on the look ou

- only the papers found out he was shagging like loads of other girls so she went and got all successful in her own right and now does a make-over show where she turns right dogs into real babes. I could do you a make-over if you'd like?
Perhaps Hanna doesn't want a make- over, sweetie. SOPHIE ignores RACHEL and addresses all her responses to HANNA.
Rachel doesn't believe in making the best of yourself.
No Sophie, I just don't believe fourteen year-old girls should be dressing to look like porn stars. It objectifies them.
Do you shave your armpits yet?
I don't think so.
Good. Keep it that way.
That's SOOO gross.
Do you often travel on your own, Hanna?
My father encourages me to be independent.
And your mother?
She's dead.
Oh, I'm sorry. 45.
Nice one, Dad.
People die.
What did she die of?
Three bullets.
Oh. God. How terrible. SOPHIE is weirdly impressed.

ERIK HELLER, still wearing his three piece suit, enters a tiny provincial Swedish butchers shop and walks up to the counter. He checks around to make sure no one is followin him before approaching the BUTCHER and slapping some cash the counter.
Three pounds of goose fat if you please.
HANNA arrives back at the hotel with RACHEL, SEB, MILES a SOPHIE. MILES is sleepy and SOPHIE a little grumpy.
Why do we always have to get up so early?
If you were a Berber shepherd -
- I'm not a shepherd. Jesus.
We have to be at the port by eight tomorrow so I want you to pack now...
I'm too sleepy. HANNA listens anxiously, knowing she needs to go with the be safe. She arrives at her door. 46.
Good night. But the family are too wrapped up in their discussion to notice her.
No, you're not. Come on we'll do it together. HANNA enters her room. SOPHIE turns at the sound of HANNA door closing.
She's weird. Is it me, or is that girl weird?

The TV flickers illuminating HANNA as she sits on her bed looking at the DNA report folded up into a tight wad. She smooths it out and reads. The test reads: HANNA HELLER - aSGM + test results. Interfering sequence present. Abnormal. B sample confirms
HANNA stares at the words. aInterfering sequence present. Abnormal.a HANNA looks at the photo of herself and those words.

What does it mean? She looks up at the TV and sees footage of millions of Mu worshipers circling the Kaaba at Mecca. The sheer mass of humanity stuns her. HANNA turns up the volume and hears t call to prayer. She listens in wonder to her first experience of music.
Music. A combination of sounds with a view to beauty of form and expression of emotion. She breathes in the beautiful sounds.

The music continues over - 47. A barren rocky outcrop on the South Swedish coast. HELLER arrives. He has a rucksack on his back. HELLER undresses and puts his suit in a plastic bag that knots tight. He puts the bag into the rucksack and puts i his back. Then HELLER starts to cover his body in the goose fat he bought in the butcher's. He stares across the water towar DENMARK in the distance.

HANNA appears in the blue morning light and stalks around car park looking for the family van. When she finds it, she tries the doors but they're locked She tries the back door but that's also locked. She gets her foot onto a wheel and another foot onto a doorhandle and climbs up onto the roof.

She studies the sun roof of the recreational vehicle. It been left open a few inches for air. She gets her hands in there and tries to prise it open further but it's mechanised and won't budge. She looks around the car park for an implement. She spies a fire escape with a caretaker's nook next to i She climbs back down off the van and goes to the caretake room.
HANNA searches the tiny office until she finds a crowbar.

A busy bustling ferry-port, cars in both directions. ISAACS looks round, makes silent contact with other men. men. Four of them dotted around the ferryport. ISAACS approaches a BORDER GUARD. The GUARD is looking at photocopied photo of HANNA from her holding cell. The GUA pockets the photocopy as ISAACS passes him a wad of cash. 48.
THE FAMILY travels towards the ferry-port, sleepy and gru yawning, looking around. The sun roof to the rear, above the breakfast table and b seats, is wide open.
... Somebody broke the sun roof. I said somebody broke the sun roof. It won't close...
Call the rental.
I hope its insured.

ISAACS watches closely every car that approaches the ferr from behind his dark glasses. He sees the FAMILY have joined a cue of vehicles and are having their papers checked. Then they're waved on board. scrutinises them but has no reason to suspect anything.
Cars are parking, their headlights on in the dark hull, h blowing, FERRY GUARDS directing people to parking spaces it's chaos. SEB parks the van with some difficulty, complaining all t while.
Typical. Get me back to the European Union.

Don't be rude. They get out, taking with them anything they might need - knapsacks, computer games, suit cases. They head off towards the stairs up to the decks, passing ISAACS on their way. ISAACS searches between the cars and trucks. He passes the back of the FAMILY'S van as the camera push in on its back door. The handle is being JIGGLED FROM INS 49.

Inside, the van is as the family left it, but the bench s around the breakfast table are disturbed. One has been op out, the lid taken off, the mattress strewn on the floor inside is a big storage space where HANNA has evidently hidden... The crowbar has been discarded there. HANNA is trying to get out. She tries the back door but i locked. She climbs over the seats and climbs into the front cabin the driver's seat. She finds a lock on the door and unloc She climbs out.

HANNA walks out on deck and sees the sea, the sight of it takes her breath away. She walks to the railings and look over the edge. Then up at the seagulls following the boat A little way off the FAMILY are sitting eating ice-creams SOPHIE lies out on a bench sunning herself.
What has got into you? Oh my God, look over there. They all look where she is pointing - at HANNA.
It's her.
You think she... you don't think she... Rachel, the sunroof?
You think we should say something?
What's there to say?
Maybe she's in trouble.
Maybe she's a hooker. Or a terrorist. There's a lot of them in Germany.
Hookers or terrorists?
I'll go over. 50.
Rachel, walk away. I'm insisting here. I'm putting my foot down... RACHEL heads off towards HANNA, SOPHIE follows.
SOPHIE and RACHEL approach HANNA and move to positions ei side of her.
All right?
Did you know that 71 percent of the earths surface is covered in water?
My father thinks you're a stowaway. He thinks you broke our sunroof too, which puts you in deep shit.
Sophie just - I'll handle this.
Where's your father? No reply.
I really think it might help if you told us the, you know, the truth and all that. Have you run away from somewhere?
Are you okay?
I'm fine.
I'm worried about you.
She said she's fine.
You have to understand this really is a problem for us. 51.
You know what? Why don't I stay here with her and you go off and be with dad? He's looking kind of tense.
RACHEL rejoins SEB and MILES.
Has she even got a passport?!
I don't think I handled that very well.
How do you know she's not some kind of illegal immigrant?

ISAACS searches the upper deck. Through the bar on the ot side of the ferry he sees one of his men searching the opposite deck. A CHILD knocks into ISAACS and the few photocopied photographs he has of HANNA fall from his pocket and are blown along the deck. ISAACS scrambles to pick-up the photocopies.
HANNA and SOPHIE are still standing at the railings. SOPH offers HANNA some of her ice-cream.
Would you like some? HANNA looks curiously at the ice-cream.
Please. She tries it.
It tastes like music.
You're so weird, aren't you? Did you have a fight with your dad or something? 52.
Yes.
Was it bad?
No. I won. HANNA studies the sea.

Can you help me get home? At that moment one of ISAACS photocopied pictures of HANN rolls across the deck and catches on the railings. HANNA looks down at it, recognizes herself and quickly pockets it. She looks across the deck, too many people, s shouldn't have let herself be so exposed.
You could do me a make-over if you like?

MILES is sitting in the driver's seat, pretending to driv the stationary van. Through the windscreen, RACHEL and SEB can be seen having heated discussion. In the back, HANNA is changing into some of SOPHIE'S clot
You're pretty. You know that?
Am I?
Of course you are. You've got pretty eyes and you're tall. I always wanted to be tall. If I were a man I might fancy you. She laughs. HANNA responds seriously.
I'm not a man. SOPHIE laughs even more. The door swings open and SEB is standing there with RACHE nervous but determined. 53.

Okay, here's the deal. We're going to find a way to get you home just as soon as we get off this crate. But since you don't have a passport with you right now, we're just going to have to be a bit gorilla. Okay?
We passionately believe it's the right thing to do. They don't look sure at all, but SOPHIE puts her arm roun HANNA and HANNA returns the gesture, everybody slightly embarrassed.
The FERRY is docked, the huge doors are open and cars are starting to drive out, halting on the dock to have passpo checked.

Cars are revving up, manoeuvring and getting ready to disembark. RACHEL is at the drivers wheel while SEB is in the back stripping the cushions from the bench seats to prepare a place for HANNA to hide. HANNA waits, breath bated, her arm round SOPHIE's shoulde On the far side she sees ISAACS enter the deck. She watch him carefully and decides he must be looking for her. She ducks down a little further. RACHEL, looking nervous, turns to HANNA.
You okay honey?
Yes yes I'm ready! ISAACS is getting closer, walking between the cars. The f gates are open and the noise subsides. SEB discovers the crowbar, examines it.
Oh Jesus. HANNA grabs it and sticks it back in the box, helps SEB f cushions aside and gets into the compartment. 54. SEB grits his teeth.

Here goes nothing. He shuts the bench seat over HANNA and replaces the cushi just as ISAACS passes the van, sniffing around. SEB gets out of the back and walks around to the front. H passes ISAACS on his way round.

Excuse me. Sir? ISAACS gets out of the way and SEB gets into the front passenger's seat. RACHEL starts the engine, checks her mirrors. SEB eyes ISAACS with some paranoia - although he has no i who he is.
HANNA lies quietly, her eyes glistening in the dark. She listens, hearing the van disembarking the ferry.

Dark rain pours down on to a beach on the Danish coast. A figure struggles to land. Then, like a monster from the deep, ERIK emerges out of the surf. His lungs bursting wi the exertion. Water dripping from his body. He collapses for a while then stumbles up the beach. He approaches the beach car park. A POLICE CAR swings into the car park. ERIK tries to run, but it's too late. The POLICE CAR is o him. He stops and turns towards the police car. TWO POLICEMEN get out of the car and approach ERIK. He watches them very carefully.
The FAMILY'S van speeds along the E-15 up from the Bay of Gibraltar, heading north east towards the mountains. 55.

HANNA stares out at the changing light in the rugged landscape. Hills are emerging and the land is turning green in the g evening light. HANNA watches RACHEL unscrew the cap of a water bottle an brings it to SEB'S mouth while he drives. SEB laughs as a little water spills down his front. SOPHIE is listening to an iPOD. HANNA looks at her. SOPHI takes one earphone out of her own ear and puts it in HANN
ISAACS shows fake ID to the ferry's frowning SECURITY OFFICER, who doesn't appreciate the unsolicited approach.
Sir, I'll be as brief as I can, we have a situation here...
ISAACS is studying CC TV footage of the ferry. He views a number of scenes with no luck until he notices: The car deck - HANNA and SOPHIE weaving through the cars boarding the van.

HANNA rests her head on SOPHIE'S shoulder and relaxes for first time. MILES relaxes his head on HANNA's shoulder an they stare at the huge, granite mountain range... She starts to nod off... she falls asleep on SOPHIE's shoulder.
MARISSA walks along the desolate patch of coastline. She approaches a Crime Scene. Dogs, markings on the ground. T DANISH POLICEMEN lie inert on the pebbles, their throats freshly sliced.
The Danish authorities are taking this very seriously. They've doubled the number of officers on the ground. We've sent up spotter planes over the channel.
They're appealing for witnesses through the local media... MARISSA nods and looks out at the roiling grey sea. The reality of ERIK'S determination unnerving her.
You think he really swam it? MARISSA knows he did. She calls over her shoulder as she walks away.
Keep me posted.

The campsite is heaving with humanity, thousands of EUROP CAMPERS who have turned the site into what amounts to a shanty town - a small city with its own shops, drainage, borders and rules. Families come here from cities across Europe and bring their whole lives with them. The LYALL FAMILY van is squeezed in between a GERMAN fami walking around in skimpy swimming costumes - and a seriou looking FRENCH family with quad bikes. SOPHIE, MILES and HANNA stare at the other families a mom GERMAN CAMPER. Guten tag.
Guten Morgen. GERMAN CAMPER. Wie geht es Ihnen?
Gutm und Ihnen? GERMAN CAMPER. Jah, gut, gut... A FRENCH CAMPER nods at them. FRENCH CAMPER. Bonjour. Ca va?

Ca va. Oui. Bien... HANNA starts efficiently helping SEB erect the children's tent. He's watches impressed as HANNA expertly ties complicated knots. RACHEL and MILES start blowing up two inflatable mattress 57.
Maybe we could all go for a walk when we've put the tent up.
No thanks. HANNA looks off to the tree line. In the distance she spo couple of RABBITS in a pool of sunlight.

HANNA turns a display unit of postcards. Through the window she can see SOPHIE talking to TWO TEEN BOYS. One of the boys enters the shop. He looks at HANNA as he passes and smiles. This is FELICIANO. He is handsome. HAN not used to this feeling of being looked at. While the SHOP ASSISTANT serves FELICIANO HANNA pockets a postcard and a book of stamps.
HANNA sits on a low wall writing her postcard: a Mission accomplished' HANNA gets up and posts the card.
RACHEL and HANNA are walking in the woods together. Above them the evening chorus is in full song.
I just feel connected when I'm in the countryside. The city stifles me... emotionally, creatively. HANNA'S attention is elsewhere, she's spotted something i the undergrowth.
Anyway, I was very young when I... Seb and I.... He was so impressive. HANNA suddenly runs into the woods.
Hanna?! 58.
The FAMILY are sitting in fold-out chairs eating charred veggie sausages.
It's probably just a bunch of Spanish farmers, mum. We're hardly going to be out all night.
You're not going, Sophie. No way, Jose. HANNA appears from the woods carrying TWO SKINNED RABBITS She lays them in front of the family.
Food. SOPHIE lets out a shriek of nervous laughter, while SEB a RACHEL are confused as to what the appropriate reaction m be.
That's gross.
The girls are hiding out in the Ladies Room as SOPHIE doe HANNA'S make-up.
I don't know why I'm doing this, you're going to steal all the best men off of me.
What do you mean?

Though quite frankly I don't need more digits than I've got right now. Loads. Loads and loads. HANNA watches herself in the mirror. Mascara, eye liner. licks the lipstick, puzzled. Almost a woman, but it doesn look right on her.
It's like paint.
Don't lick it off. SOPHIE finishes HANNA's face, looks at her in the mirror. 59.
You're gorgeous.

SOPHIE and HANNA sneak through the campsite together and secretly between the parked cars. HANNA is dressed in som SOPHIE's clothes and has the make-up on. They are excited SOPHIE alive with the thrill of disobedience.
I can't walk in this.
You look hot.
Where are we going?
Shhhhh! HANNA uncomfortable with the situation.
I shouldn't take unnecessary risks.
Says who? SOPHIE heads off down the road. HANNA weighs the situation and then quickens her pace to catch up with SOPHIE.

A loud out door rave in a Roman amphitheatre. SOPHIE and HANNA stand at the top of the amphitheatre loo down on the thrilling spectacle, soaking up the bass, the abstract sounds, the sheer volume, the pulsing lights and electric atmosphere - HANNA is thrilled and startled. Many of the crowd seem to be wearing fancy dress. HANNA stares at a girl dressed as a red ladybird.
The girls approach a bar and SOPHIE goes to order. She's forced to mime and shout her order over the music.
Vodka. Two. 60. The bartender shakes his head and holds up two bottles of water.

Water only. No booze. Meanwhile HANNA spots FELICIANO, the handsome SPANISH BOY from the camp site shop, across the dance floor. He is staring at her again. SOPHIE comes back with two bottles of water and hands one HANNA.
What do they call this music?
Banging. HANNA stares at the dancers, people losing themselves in SOPHIE just grins, starts to move to the music. HANNA smiles awkwardly, tries to copy SOPHIE.

ISAACS enters the rave followed by two of his HENCHMEN. T split up and start to survey the crowd. Over in a secluded corner ISAACS sees a drug deal taking place. ISAACS sidles over to the DEALER and his PUNTER. The PUNT thinking ISAACS is probably a cop, makes a hasty getaway.
What you got?
(in Spanish w/ English

Nothing man. That guys just a friend. ISAACS frisks the DEALER, nothing. He turns the DEALER against the wall and checks his socks where he finds a st of tiny baggies each containing a gram or two of white powder. ISAACS samples the powder and pockets the lot.
(in Spanish w/ English
Hey, you're not police. What the fuck? ISAACS turns as he walks away and puts a finger to his li 61.
Ssh.
Back near the bar HANNA and SOPHIE are approached by a co of scrawny SPANISH BOYS in day-glow tops.
(in Spanish w/ English
Where are you from? The girls just look at each other.
English? American? You like to party? They watch, puzzled, as SOPHIE smiles disinterestedly and leads HANNA away.
Will you teach me to do dancing?

It's easy. HANNA and SOPHIE walk onto the dance floor and begin to dance. HANNA starts by dancing like a five year-old, swinging he arms jerkily and lifting her feet as if walking through a field. But soon her movements become more sophisticated a expressive.
ISAACS is searching through the crowd. He eyes the bodies around him greedily. He takes another dab of the white powder and rubs it into gums.
Back on the dance floor, HANNA and SOPHIE are dancing. FELICIANO approaches through the crowd followed by a FRIE THEY start to circle HANNA and SOPHIE, dancing, insinuati their way in.
He's after you.
How can you tell? 62.
Duh, look at the way he's looking at you. He's gorgeous. FELICIANO'S FRIEND approaches SOPHIE, he's not bad lookin either.
What's your name?
Sophie.
Have you come here before?
All the time.
Really? You dance well.

So do you. HANNA and FELICIANO hold eye contact. The music rises and now they're lit only by the intermitt flashes of a strobe light. HANNA and FELICIANO begin to dance around each other, the movements caught in still flashes.
From some distance away ISAACS spots HANNA. He smiles and starts to move through the crowds towards her.

SOPHIE and the FRIEND are kissing. HANNA sees this and laughs. The crowd is jumping. HANNA feels FELICIANO'S hand take hers, she flinches a moment, then lets him draw her towards him. Their eyes st locked. ISAACS is getting closer, his eyes flashing eerily in the strobe lighting. HANNA and FELICIANO are in a world of their own. His fingers trace the lines of her arms, shoulders and ne He draws her face towards his. 63.
Are we going to kiss now?
Would you like to?
Kissing requires a total of thirty- four facial muscles. Their lips are almost touching.

The most important muscle involved is the orbicularis oris muscle, which is used to pucker the lips - He kisses her. HANNA closes her eyes. ISAACS moves in. FELICIANO becomes more ardent, puts his arms around her waist, she doesn't like it. He tries to open her mouth wi his. HANNA snaps. In a few swift moves, HANNA pulls FELICIANO round and thr him to the ground. She falls to his side and, with one kn on his back, she holds his head, about to snap his neck. SOPHIE turns and sees them on the ground. A few of the closest DANCERS also stop dancing and stare. ISAACS backs off, watching from a safe distance.
Hanna! Holy crap...
Please, don't hurt me.
Please, tell your friend... HANNA looks up at SOPHIE. Now that she has FELICIANO on t ground she doesn't know what to do with him.
Should I let him go?
As opposed to what? Yes, you should let him go. HANNA leans in to whisper into FELICIANO'S ear. 64.
I'm going to go now.
Sure.

It was nice. And she's gone, pulling SOPHIE away through the crowd. ISAACS jumps into action. But he's lost sight of the girl among the mass of dancing bodies. HANNA and SOPHIE move quickly through the crowds towards exit.
Oh, my God, Hanna. I thought you were going to kill him. Where d'you learn to do that?
My father taught me. They escape through a hole in the perimeter fence.

An immaculately tidy lounge in a small apartment on the ground floor of a run down East Berlin housing project. A well-dressed woman in her 60's, KATRIN, is sitting alon listening to music on an old casette machine. The door buzzer rings. KATRIN gets up slowly and approach the door.
Who is it? No reply. KATRIN puts the safety chain across the door an opens it a small amount.
Hello Katrin. KATRIN slams the door shut in fright and double locks it. Fear racing through her veins, she rushes her way through lounge, knocking furniture as she goes.

KATRIN races to the kitchen door and bolts it. 65. Thinking the apartment is secure, she tries to catch her breath. But slowly she becomes aware of someone else's presence in the room. She turns to face the intruder... MARISSA standing, waiti patiently.
You look different in pictures.
Well here I am in the flesh. KATRIN'S mouth twitches with all the imagined conversatio she's had with MARISSA.
Has Erik Heller contacted you?
Erik's dead. MARISSA sits calmly in an old arm chair.
Huh, if only.
If he's alive why would he contact me?
That depends on whether you believe he's innocent, or not.
I'm an old woman with a broken
- What's in the past, stays in the past, right?
Something like that.
So why all the years of snooping around and sticking your nose in?
You'd understand if you had kids. She turns her back on MARISSA.

Kid's, they fuck you up, don't they? 66. MARISSA stands up, puts a 9mm to the back KATRIN'S head a pulls the trigger. KATRIN drops to the floor revealing a framed, blood splattered, photograph of KATRIN ZADEK'S daughter - JOANN
HANNA and SOPHIE lie next to each other in sleeping bags a torch between them.
Can't you sleep?
No.
Me neither. SOPHIE pauses. Looks at her.
Hanna?
Yes?
Where do you really come from?
Leipzig, I live in Leipzig - SOPHIE looses her patience.
If we're going to be friends you have to be honest with me. Them's the rules. HANNA is taken aback.
Are we friends?
Yes. I like you.
I'd like to have a friend.
I mean you're a freak and everything, but I like you. 67.
I like you too. I really do. But there are things I can't tell you. Do you understand?
Yes... Actually, no, I don't.
There are people that want to harm me. Bad people.
I see.
And they wont stop.
Right.
So for your own safety... HANNA looks into SOPHIE'S eyes.
Can we still be friends?
I don't know. I mean, I don't really know who you are. Do I?
That's just it. Neither do I. She reaches into her bag. Brings out the DNA report. Show to Sophie. They read. Interfering Sequence. Abnormal.
What is it?
I think it's about me. DNA is kind of how we're made I think. I mean who we are. They look at it.
What will you do?
I'm going to Berlin. I have to meet my father at the house of Wilhelm Grimm. 68.
As in aGrimm's Fairytalesa?
That's right. SOPHIE sighs at HANNA.
If you say so.
Did I say the wrong thing again? SOPHIE looks at HANNA, sees she's vulnerable. She takes a bracelet off her own wrist. Gives it to her.
Keep this. To remember me. HANNA takes it, puts it on. Moved. Looks at SOPHIE.
It's a friendship bracelet.

Thank you. HANNA stares at the ceiling, looks over at SOPHIE who's starting to sleep. HANNA reaches out and touches her hair Beside them, separated by a thin piece of fabric, we see MILES has woken and has been listening in the darkness.

MARISSA is searching the apartment. She's thorough and fa She rips cushions and throws books from their shelves. He actions become progressively more frantic, relishing the destruction. She finds more and more photograph's of JOAN The photographs seem to have a driving effect on her. She walks down the hall and opens a door onto a small spa bedroom that had been turned into home office. Every available wall space is covered in newspaper clippings an photographs relating JOANNA'S murder. On the floor MARISSA finds a box of old casette tapes. Sh stops to inspect one of the tapes. A label reads: a Joann 24'.

ERIK HELLER walks into a small, long-established family h on a Danish road near the coast. 69. He is in the slightly dated suit he wore when he left the forest and looks a little dishevelled and odd. A sixtyish Danish woman stands behind the counter, scrutinising him. They speak in Danish with English subtitles.
I need a room.
Yes of course.
I stayed here fifteen years ago. It hasn't changed.
We don't much like change here.
Neither do I.
Name?
Olsson. Peter Olsson.
You have some post. She turns and retrieves HANNA'S POSTCARD from the mail ra and hands it to him.
Thank you. ERIK reads: aMission accomplisheda
Have you heard about the manhunt? A man has killed two coastguards. Everybody is being asked to keep an eye out.
For what exactly?
I don't know. He smiles. She takes a closer look and notices goose fat smeared behind his ear.. and blood on a shirt cuff...
The FAMILY have checked out and are leaving the campsite. 70.
How long until you drop me off?
We should have you there by dinner time. From Lille you can get a train to Berlin. Leipzig's just a few hours further. HANNA and SOPHIE exchange a look.

The FAMILY van passes through the campsite gates to revea ISAACS coming out of the reception hut. He sees the van, recognises it. He sees the kids in the b Bingo. He runs to a black BMW where two of his HENCHMEN a waiting for him.
Wake up. It's them. He jumps in the passenger seat whilst the driver revs the engine. The BMW pulls out in front of an oncoming truck narrowly avoiding a collision.
ISAACS holds onto the dash.
Keep your distance.
The RECEPTIONIST picks up the phone and dials.
Is that the police? Yes, I don't want to trouble you but I have a new guest you may wish to know about.

A commuter train pulls into the vast station. Amongst the morning commuters alighting the train is ERIK HELLER. He looks furtively around, and tries to blend in with the cr 71. POV - from a walkway above the station - someone is watch HELLER as he tries to conceal himself within the throng. DANISH AGENT, hidden on a metal walkway above the platfor On the platform HELLER walks amongst the commuters, past ticket collectors, past another DANISH AGENT posing as a commuter - he stops and lingers by him, noting something right. He moves off and enters a small bar. The second AGENT immediately follows and from the walkway the other rushes downstairs to give chase too. HELLER walks through the bar into the toilets, finds a FI EXIT and walks out through it.

HELLER finds himself in a goods yard adjoining the train station. He walks through the goods yard, then suddenly, apparently for no reason, stops dead, then throws himself behind a skip of empty bottles. As he does two new men, AMERICAN SPECIAL OPS, run round t corner into the goods yard. From the fire exit, the DANISH AGENTS EMERGE and after signalling to each other, head off to the perimeter. The various agents scour the yard. The SPECIAL OPS get cl to HELLER's hiding place. HELLER suddenly emerges from hi hiding place and sticks an elbow in the face of one, a kn in the groin of another. There's a brief exchange of blows. One of the SPECIAL OPS draws his hand gun. HELLER produces a knife out of nowhere and launches at th man, cutting him on the hand, making him drop his gun. He stabs the other in the eye and the man falls to the gr squealing. HELLER leans in and takes from the man's pocket his CELLPHONE. HELLER makes a run for it. One of the SPECIAL OPS lets of shot, the bullet clipping HELLER in the leg. He falters but limps off behind the towering containers.
The FAMILY van is making its way up through France. 72. Following in the black BMW, a few cars behind, ISAACS and HENCHMEN are biding their time.
RACHEL is driving, while HANNA rides in the front seat keeping her entertained.
...they can live at freezing temperatures for up to nine months without food. Imagine that, nine months.
Why do you know so much about fleas?
I read it in my Encyclopaedia. HANNA is looking in the side view mirror. She sees ISAACS and frowns, she's seen it before.

Also, they can jump around 200 times their own body length, which makes them the best jumpers of all known animals except for the froghopper. Now they can really jump. RACHEL makes a turn and HANNA checks the side view mirror again. Yes, the BMW is still there. HANNA becomes anxious
Everything all right?
I think so. But HANNA'S face betrays her concern.
Mama, I know you're disappointed in me, I know it. I'm so sorry, Mama. But I have found maybe a way to make it better...
CLOSE ON - a portable casette machine playing one of the tapes MARISSA discovered at KATRIN ZADEK'S. 73.
I'm in a program now... a program to make babies stronger. In an adjoining bathroom MARISSA, in a pair of cotton pyjamas, is brushing her teeth. Her lips pulled back in a snarl.
An American program. It's very scientific. Important scientific work. Still brushing MARISSA walks through to the tape machine presses fast forward. Then play -
Erik says he can get these tapes to
Bastard.
- He says I look beautiful. I don't feel beautiful... MARISSA doesn't care, fast forwards. Play -
...I'm not sure if it's true that the baby can hear, but at night I sing. I hope it hears me. MARISSA listens, for some unknown reason to MARISSA this catches her imagination. The phone rings.
What?
Frau Wiegler, this is reception. I have one Erik Heller for you. MARISSA stops dead.
Put him on.
You were supposed to be dead.
So were you. 74.
A phone booth in a city park. ERIK shivering in the cold icy rain falls around him, he's holding the CELLPHONE he stole from the dead SPECIAL OPS. HELLER'S leg is bleeding profusely.
Well, here we are.
How did you know I was here?
I killed one of your men. Got his cellphone. You've gotten soft.
No, I just grew up. The world's changed since you died.
You got kids?
MARISSA stops, taken aback by the question.
No, I made choices.
Hanna's practically yours, you know? This goes straight to an ache that's been building in MARISSA.
Not interested. But she is.
She's true and good and funny. Yeah, she's funny. She's special. You should see her.
I'm looking forward to it.
You'll have to catch her first. The line goes dead. MARISSA puts the phone down and sits quietly for a moment. Then presses play again on the tape machine. 75.
Was it like this for you, Mama? I think I know what the baby looks like. I think it's a girl -- I hope so.
The FAMILY'S van drives - behind ISAACS BMW tails it, lig on high beam.
I wonder who she'll be? I hope she's smart. I hope she's a stronger person than I am.
HANNA sits beside her in the passenger seat, her anxiety growing. RACHEL is still at the wheel, watching the bright headlig behind.

Shit. Shit, shit, shit. I think we're lost, Hanna. HANNA checks the side view mirror again and sees ISAACS B She's knows that whoever is driving that car is after her She looks back and sees SEB, SOPHIE and MILES all comfort asleep. MILES' fingers wrapped around a Transformers toy.
I'm going to pull over.
No, don't.
I need to check the map.

The van slowly pulls in at the side of the road. RACHEL waits for the BMW behind to pass but instead it pu in behind the van. On either side of the road is an enormous container park. containers are piled on top of each other like a giant ba building blocks. 76.
Why won't that car pass? He has his lights on high beam, I was doing everything I could to get out of the way... SOPHIE wakes up in the back.
Are we stopped? I need to pee.
Well, I don't want you going too far right now.

I think you should stay where you are, Sophie. HANNA doesn't take her eyes off the mirror. She can see t silhouettes of ISAACS and his MEN. They don't move and neither does HANNA. Both are waiting for the other to mak the first move.
Hanna, what's going on. Seb wake up.
Please.
This is creepy. You're creeping me out.
Are we in Lille?
I'm sorry. But you really mustn't get out of the van. HANNA climbs into the back of the van and comes very clos SOPHIE.
