What ever you do, don't follow me. Promise not to follow me.
I promise.
Hanna, tell me what's going on or Seb will go over to that car and find out. 77.
Like fuck I will. Everyone stay put. Where's my phone?
Thank you for being my friend. HANNA looks back at the BMW. All at once all four of the doors open. In a flash, HANNA pulls open the van's side door and bolt from the van.
Hanna! RACHEL sees ISAACS and one of the HENCHMEN chase after HA The SECOND HENCHMAN appears at her drivers window aiming gun at her head. RACHEL screams.

HANNA sprints across hard tarmac heading for the relative safety of the container park. ISAACS and his HENCHMAN follow at speed. HANNA enters a dark gully between two enormous containers ISAACS slips around the other side to block her off. He signals to the HENCHMAN to loop around and flank HANNA. HANNA moves quietly between the containers, turning this and that. ISAACS voice comes echoing through the maze.
Don't be a silly girl, Hanna. You need to come with me now. I know where your papa is. She listens.
ISAACS, his gun in hand, calls out again.
He wants to talk to you, Hanna. He misses you.

The HENCHMAN appears directly behind HANNA. HANNA double- kicks him in the chest. 78. HANNA pulls herself up the side of the containers and scrambles on top of them and runs, jumping between the containers when she reaches a gap. The HENCHMAN appears having climbed up too. A chase ensues. HANNA, followed by the HENCHMAN climbing higher, now four containers high. ISAACS follow below. HANNA jumps an enormous gap between two containers and ri over the head of ISAACS. HANNA slips and tumbles but catches the edge of one of th containers on her way down. She hangs there a moment, the pushes herself off the side of the container and manages land on a lower container on the other side. HANNA running across the tops of the containers sees the HENCHMAN appear at the far edge. She grabs a discarded wr and throws it at the man, catching him in the side of the head - a perfect aim - and he tumbles to the ground. She descends the containers with nimble leaps and comes t the ground. She's running now through a maze of tight alleys between containers. She stops at a a T' junction, unsure which wa go. Suddenly ISAACS appears at the end of one alley, HENC ONE at the end of another, and HENCHMAN TWO at the end of third. She's trapped.

Just take it easy. HANNA makes her decision and runs straight at ISAACS. He stretches out his arms in an attempt to catch her. She hits him like a bowling ball hitting the last pin and crashes to the ground. She rolls and springs to her feet. The HENCHMEN follow but HANNA is too quick.

HANNA sprints full tilt out of the container park and thr a scrap metal yard. Either side of her rise mountains of waste. HANNA reaches the edge of an industrial canal from where scrap metal is unloaded. 79. A large industrial barge is passing beneath. HANNA jumps lands on the moving barge. Then quickly takes cover under tarpaulin.

Four holding cells in a row, each one holding a member of family. SEB paces around his cell. RACHEL sits stoically in hers. SOPHIE is crying in her cell while MILES is playing with Nintendo in his cell. MARISSA walks into SOPHIE'S cell.
Would you please stop crying?
I'm not telling you anything.
Honey, your friend is in a lot of danger. You need to help us find her.
I don't know where to find her! MARISSA grits her teeth, shows SOPHIE a photo of FELICIAN
Do you know him?
No.
He knows you.
MARISSA now in RACHEL'S cell.
We gave her a ride because we thought she was in trouble.
But you knew she didn't have a passport. You smuggled her into port and helped her illegally gain
She said she lived in Leipzig. She went to the Klaus Kohle Gymnasium. 80.
There is no Klaus Kohle Gymnasium. It closed five years ago. Shock on Rachel's face.
Did she give any idea of where she was going? Rachel wracks her brains.
She said she was going home, to Leipzig. She seemed lost. Like she needed taking care of. (woman to woman) You understand. MARISSA shows her the photograph of JOANNA ZADEK.
This was Hanna's mother, Joanna Zadek. Fifteen years ago Hanna's father shot her to death on a camping holiday by the Baltic. RACHEL swallows, goes pale.
MARISSA now in SEB'S cell.
She was odd. I'll give you that. Disconnected. I mean I get on with most kids, you know, have a rapport. But, this one -
You know, Mr Lyall, it's days like these that I really hate my job.
I'm sure you do.
It's a very, very difficult thing to do.
Absolutely.
But sometimes children are bad people too.
MARISSA in MILES'S cell. MILES is terrified of MARISSA. S puts her hand out and strokes his hair.
I'm not going to hurt you. MILES shrinks from her touch.
Miles is a nice name. Are you a nice boy? She strokes MILES' hair and immediately he starts crying loudly. SEB pounds on the wall from his cell.
Hey what's going on in there? We don't have to put up with this! We're in the EU, Goddammit!

location: BARGE. RURAL FRANCE INTO GERMANY. DAWN 151

text: HANNA watches as the sun rises over the misty fields eith side be the canal. It's a beautiful sight. HANNA is stran peaceful.
Now the whole family are reunited in MILES' cell. He snif and plays with his Nintendo. The others look wan as MARIS passes around a photo of the two dead DANISH POLICEMEN. T family go silent.
Three days ago Hanna's father killed two Danish policemen on a beach with a hunting knife.
Where is he now?
He's still at large and he's still very dangerous. We need to find Hanna before he does. Pause. SOPHIE thinks about it but clams up. Marissa notic
If you know anything at all, it's vital you tell us for her own safety. We are now very worried about her. 82. But SOPHIE doesn't say a word.
Sophie? Still nothing. They all look at her. MILES suddenly speak
She's going to Berlin. To Wilhelm Grimm's house.
You little bastard!
How did you know that?
You fuckwad! SOPHIE slaps MILES over the back of the head but SEB push her back.
Hey hey hey! Sophie for God's sake.
HANNA'S sits on the prow of the barge as it makes it's sl progress into Berlin.
MARISSA looks out at a school playground as she waits in back of her car. The passenger door next to her opens and ISAACS gets in.
I've looked through Heller's contacts from the 1980's. There's no one called Wilhelm.

Wilhelm Grimm wrote fairy-tales. He died two hundred years ago. MARISSA hands ISAACS a brown envelope containing one of t photographs she took from KATRIN'S apartment. The photograph shows a happy looking JOANNA and ERIK at a busy family amusement park. Between ERIK and JOANNA is a clown, his arms around both of them. This we will come to understand is KLAUS KNEPFLER. Behind them is a GRIMM'S BROTHERS HOUSE OF FUN. 83.
What the hell is this? MARISSA smiles slightly.
Wilhelm's house. (to the DRIVER) Drive on.
HANNA wanders through the skyscrapers and glass construct of Berlin. People swarm around her but pay her no mind.
HANNA is riding a tram to the outskirts of town.

HANNA walks beside a wire mesh fence that separates her f an abandoned amusement park. Behind her is an enormous st works from which great industrial plumes of steam rise. HANNA climbs under the fence and walks through this surre playground long since reclaimed by nature. There are huge fibreglass dinosaurs toppled over with heads missing and abandoned dinosaur legs. Rising above the park, surrounde a muddy moat, is the big wheel now standing at a vertigin angle. In front of the big wheel is the WILHELM GRIMM HOU The house is a Grimm Brothers fairytale theme a Fun House It's windows long since shuttered, vines growing through roof. HANNA stands in front of the house in deep anticipation. walks up the small steps that lead to the front door and knocks. She waits, heart sinking at the thought of there being no-one home. Then, ever so slightly the door opens peering out at her is a man with the sad face of an out o work clown.
Excuse me young lady? It is the man from the photo, but twenty years older. Sma with a wiry intensity.
Are you Wilhelm Grimm? 84.
Not exactly, but it'll do for now. Come this way. He leads her inside.
They come inside - it's old and full of hoarded junk, antiques, boxes, books, dusty china, lamps, figurines, bu still functional - an old man's home. He stops to look at her.
So you are Hanna. He puts out his hand to shake.
It's very nice to meet you, Hanna. HANNA smiles and shakes his hand, she likes him already. KNEPFLER studies her, quietly moved by his memories.
My real name is Knepfler. Herr Knepfler. I'm an old friend of your father's. I am a sort of acaretakera here.
What happened to it?
No car park. You need a car park these days, otherwise people wont come. But somebody has to watch over it...
It's beautiful.
I like it too. Erik used to come here a great deal.
Have you heard from him? He nods.

You must wait. He will be here soon. HANNA stares, not quite believing. 85. HANNA stares out the window, thinking all this through. KNEPFLER leads HANNA through a reception area and under a spider with a human face that straddles a door to a run d kitchen.
HANNA follows KNEPFLER into the kitchen.
Please, sit down. HANNA sits at the old kitchen table on a wooden bench, wh KNEPFLER goes to the stove.
Would you like an egg? They're fresh.
Please. HANNA takes an egg, breaks it and swallows it raw. KNEPFLER smiles. He gives her a buff envelope. She looks inside - some money, a passport, ID cards.
You'll need a fresh photograph. Don't get it wet. HANNA looks at the passport with a new name - ANNA-MARIE ELKAN. She takes a deep breath, not really comprehending.
I don't really understand.
ID. Identity. It tells people who you are. She stares at the passport with the blank space for her photo.
There is an apartment ready for you in the south. Erik will come and the car will take you there today. You will live there now.
Do I have to?
Don't you want to? 86.
I don't know. I miss the forest. I miss my home.
That's to be expected. But the city is so exciting, don't you think?
I suppose. She drinks her water, thinking.
Did you know my mother?
I did.
What was she like?
She was very gentle, she was very funny, very talented - a singer - did you know that?
Yes...
She had your eyes. He smiles at her. She here's a noise outside and runs to look out the windo She sees ISAACS BMW pull up outside the house followed by second car.
It's him.
Quick. KNEPFLER leads HANNA out of the kitchen.
The driver of the second car gets out and opens the back for MARISSA. She gets out and looks up at the house. 87.
KNEPFLER points HANNA towards a set of stairs that lead u from the reception.
Upstairs. There's a knock at the door. HANNA begins to climb the stairs while KNEPFLER approache the front door. There's another knock at the door.

HANNA enters a room that's been designed to look like Grandma's bedroom from Little Red Riding Hood. HANNA hurriedly slides under the bed. Breathing as quietl she can. She can hear the sound of ISAAC'S MEN starting to spread through the house.
Listen to me, listen. There is no one here. There is nobody up there...
Check the attic. Footsteps to the attic.
MARISSA has KNEPFLER cornered on the stairs.
Erik Heller? Do you know him?
I have never heard of him.
Really? MARISSA shows him the photograph of JOANNA, ERIK and KNEP outside the house.
I don't know these people. 88.
Think very carefully He shrugs and MARISSA grabs KNEPFLER by the throat. He sp in gasps.
He called me. She's coming soon. To meet him.
When?
Tomorrow! Tomorrow morning. MARISSA lets him go. She turns to ISAACS.
Take him in there. Find out what he knows.

The sound of KNEPFLER being escorted into a next-door roo the door shutting. The sound of footsteps coming into the room. HANNA silent under the bed. MARISSA'S GREEN SHOES a in sight, nothing else. The green shoes come close and HANNA feels the mattress compress as MARISSA sits on the bed. She looks at the sho as she hears her call.
Lewis. It's Marissa. HANNA hears the name. The name of the woman she thought s had killed. Her face pale in shock and fear.
You got anything? He's coming here. I can smell it. Double the men. But, Lewis, I want to talk to him. HANNA hears MARISSA hang. Another pair of shoes enter the room. Male. ISAACS.
His name's Klaus Knepfler. He used to send Heller's things from Berlin before the Communists were kicked out of Prague.
How much does he know about the programme? 89.
Everything. He knew Johanna.
What does he know about the child?
He also thinks Erik's the father.
Well that's good.
Everybody thinks Erik's her father. Erik probably thinks he's her father. They snigger. HANNA's eyes widen in shock. She can barely control her breath.
Crazy bastard. You got a fix on him yet?

Let's see what else Knepfler has to offer. He leaves her. MARISSA suddenly senses something. Did she hear an intake of breath? She turns and quickly looks und the bed. No one there. Her imagination maybe. MARISSA stands and we see the shoes walk away to the door They reach the door. HANNA, clinging to the bedsprings in air, not breathing. The green shoes leave. HANNA breathes Hurriedly she climbs out from under the bed and goes to a window.
HANNA lands having jumped from the window. She looks around quickly. Then, out of sight from the car the front of the house, she runs for dear life.

HANNA walking fast, in total shock and confusion. Who is She walks head down, determined not to be seen. Not knowi where she is going. Her world turned upside down. She see internet cafe. Ducks into it. 90.
HANNA sits down at a computer. The young OWNER comes up t her.
Excuse me. You have to pay first.
How much?
3 Euros for half an hour. She looks at the money that Knepfler gave her. It contain Euros. She hands some over to the OWNER.
How does it work?
You've never used the internet?
No. He smiles in amazement and logs on for her. The owner bri up a search engine.
Just type whatever it is you're looking for here. He walks away and HANNA slowly starts to type. She types DNA INTERFERING SEQUENCE.

ERIK HELLER limps, head bowed, through the Amusement Park He suddenly stops dead and ducks behind a fallen fibregla dinosaur as he sees two CIA AGENTS sitting in a car outsi the house. HELLER watches for a moment or two. Then, keeping low, he makes a painful run towards the hou HELLER throws himself against the back wall of the kitche He breathes heavily for a moment, clutching his wounded l He turns and rises to look through the kitchen window. Inside he sees KNEPFLER, stripped to the waist his body bloodied, hanging upside down from a meat hook. He's obviously dead. 91. HELLER crouches back down against the wall, thinking furiously. Then, decision made, he checks sight lines and runs back across the Amusement Park away from the house.

HANNA sits at the computer, looking at the screen breathl with tension. Phrases from the text leap out at her. aAn interfering sequence within the DNAa , aintervention to the mother's uterus during pregnancy.a HANNA stands in shock. She reads again. aIntervention to mother's uterusa HANNA deletes the page. Sits in shock. Then writes in her mother's name. JOHANNA ZADEK. Immediately the article about JOHANNA's death comes up. H stares at it. She reads it. No mention of a child. There an address for Johanna Zadek. She came from the Heizinger Buildings area in the suburbs of East Berlin. HANNA write down. Gets up and leaves.

HANNA sits in the back of a taxi as it takes her into a g concrete jungle of old East German housing projects. HANNA looks at the thousands of tiny windows, so many liv being lived in unawareness. Is this normality? Is this th world she longed to be a part of?
MARISSA and ISAACS wait in Grandma's Room. ISAAC's phone rings.
Isaacs. He listens. Puts the phone down.
A public computer at a Berlin internet cafe just did a web search for aDNA Interfering Sequencea.
Hanna?
Next they searched the name Johanna Zadek. 92. MARISSA stops dead. Looks at ISAACS.
She's not coming here.

location: KATRIN ZADEK'S APARTMENT BLOCK. EAST BERLIN HOUS

text: HANNA gets out of the taxi and looks up at an enormous gr housing block - the Heizinger building. She approaches the entrance and looks on all the buzzers. Sees a name scrawled on one - Number 14. Zadek. She presses the buzzer. Waits. No answer. A GANG OF KURDISH YOUTHS come out the block and HANNA cat the door and enters.

HANNA knocks at the door of number 14, waits, knocks agai louder. No reply. A door further along opens. Kurdish music pours out. A KURDISH WOMAN wrapped in shawls emerges pushing a pram. S followed by her two other CHILDREN.
(In German w/ English
Excuse me. I'm looking for Joanna Zadek's house. Can you help? The KURDISH WOMAN wont look HANNA in the eye as she passe She mutters her response.
(In Kurdish w/ English
I don't speak German. HANNA kicks at the door but knows it won't be answered so doesn't wait.

head_text.subj: EXT/INT. KATRIN ZADEK'S APARTMENT. EAST BERLIN HOUSIN

text: HANNA walks round to the back door of the apartment and approaches the kitchen window. She peers through. On first inspection the kitchen seems undisturbed. Then H sees the framed photograph of JOANNA on the wall. Blood splattered across the glass. 93. HANNA quickly moves to the door, tries to force it. She l around, no-one's coming. With a sharp kick she smashes th glass.

HANNA climbs through the broken glass into the kitchen. T air is thick with the buzz of Bluebottle flies. HANNA sees the photograph of JOANNA. With some trepidatio she moves round the kitchen table and sees the body of KA ZADEK. The back of KATRIN'S head is blown clean away. The flies have laid their eggs in the bloody mess of her brai that spreads across the cheap lino floor. HANNA steps back and gags. She backs out of the kitchen and into the hall. Turns and goes through into the lounge. The lounge has been over thrown. Cushions ripped, shelvin pulled down. HANNA stares at the destruction wrought by MARISSA'S hunt for information. HANNA turns, walks back down the hall and passes a door t tiny second bedroom. She stops and enters. The room had been turned into a home office, there are newspaper clippings relating to JOANNA'S MURDER and photographs of JOANNA herself covering every available wa space. A testament to KATRIN'S unremitting search for the truth behind her daughters murder. HANNA begins to search the room for clues. Anything that help her understand who she is and where she came from. Then suddenly she hears a quiet familiar voice.
You won't find anything. HANNA turns in shock.
Marissa would have been much too careful for that. HANNA stares at him. ERIK HELLER.
Sit down Hanna.
Are you my father?
Sit down. 94.
Are you my father?
Please.
Are you? Moment of electric silence between them. ERIK does nothin but she knows the answer is no.
I was going to tell you. HANNA sinks to the floor. Breathing fast.
What's wrong with me? ERIK flinches slightly.
Nothing.
Where was I born? ERIK knows he has to tell the truth.
At Galinka.
What's that?
It was a secret CIA research programme in rural Poland.
What kind of research?
Children. HANNA stares at ERIK.
It was run by Marissa Wiegler. The science came from the old East Germany. The money from the CIA. The intention was to explore whether small genetic changes could be made to embryos... to improve
Improve? ERIK looks at her. She looks so young, so numb, so lost.
Reduce capacity for fear. For pity. Increase muscle strength. Heighten senses. Anything that might make a better soldier. HANNA looks up, stares at him. It's her he's talking abou
How did you know about it? ERIK's stares right at her.
I worked for it. She stares at him. He hands her a piece of paper from his pocket.

This is what you were looking for. HANNA reads. It is an invitation to Johanna Zadek to participate in the Galinka project. A projected date of arrival at the Galinka Centre. A date - 23rd February 199 An agreed fee to be paid to Johanna. Five hundred America dollars. An agreement to give up the child and have no le claim over it. The letter is signed by Erik Heller.
I recruited your mother at an abortion clinic in May 1994. She was about to terminate an unwanted pregnancy. Some boy at a disco. HANNA looks at the paper in shock.
I had recruited twenty women. She was the last. She was different. Two years later I heard the programme was to be terminated. The research adisposed ofa.
Disposed of?
I tried to save all of you. But you were the only one I was able to rescue. 96. HANNA stands in shock. She reaches to the window of the r to get some air. She is reeling - faint.
Hanna listen to me.
Keep away from me. ERIK approaches her. With real conviction.
It worked. You worked.
You mean I'm a killer?
No... no.. He makes to touch her. HANNA springs back in violent repulsion.
Don't touch me.
We have a new identity for you. A new life. A new beginning. She stares at him, then pushes past him. ERIK stops, push her back but then HANNA grabs a sharp letter opener.

Don't. She attacks, ERIK pushes her to one side, grabs her. A fi in the apartment. Chaos, photos of Johanna crashing, lamp and bookshelves falling. HANNA murderous, ERIK just defen himself, not willing to hurt her. But then she overpowers him, has a knife to his throat.
Let me go. He releases her. She goes to the door.
I tried to prepare you for what your life would be.
You didn't prepare me for this. And her look is so full of pain that in that moment ERIK knows he has done a terrible wrong. She starts to leave d the fire escape. ERIK calls after her. 97.

Hanna wait. He looks out to watch her go. It's then ERIK sees the car coming across the estate scrubland. ERIK turns in panic. And dashes back into the apartment, through the destroyed living room, and out through the fr door.
ERIK comes out of the main entrance and runs into full vi of the cars, deliberately distracting them from HANNA.
MARISSA's car is a about to turn the corner and bump stra into HANNA when suddenly... MARISSA sees ERIK leaving the front of the apartment bloc She speaks to ISAACS.
That's him. And the car swerves to follow him. Thus moving unknowingl away from the slight figure of HANNA. HANNA can see the c in full chase of Erik Heller. He has distracted them.

HELLER sprints fast across the wasteland. Incredible athleticism. He dives down a side alley, losing his pursu for a second. Takes out a gun, looking for Marissa. Looki to finish it off. Just as he has done this ISAACS' HENCHMAN approach from t end of the street. HELLER fires in their direction, start run down an alley. He vaults a dividing wall, scratching himself on barbed wire. He sprints round a corner and see doorway ahead of him. He walks towards the doorway.
Drop it. MARISSA steps out of the doorway, her gun trained on him. There are men at the end of the alleyway. No escape. HELL drops his gun. Silence between them. He turns to look her in the eye. 98.
So go ahead. She stares at him. Wants to make this as painful as she c for him.
You know I'll find her.
Don't under estimate what you created.
What we created, together.
HANNA is walking fast across the grim grey estate to a ma road.
MARISSA with her gun still at ERIK.
Truth is I was always very fond of you.

CLOSE ON - HANNA continuing to walk away. She hears a single gun shot. Stops dead. Knows what it me An intense conflict of emotions inside her. Her breathing stops for a moment, her world seems to go silent. Then a car flies by on the main road, almost running her over, and she is woken. She sees a bus stop ahead. On aut pilot she runs to it, a bus coming, she beckons. It stops she is on board.
MARISSA stands over the dead body of ERIK HELLER.
Leave him here. And they all walk away leaving him alone in the East Berl dirt. 99.

HANNA on the bus. Shaking from the shock of his death, bloodied slightly from the fight. The other passengers st at her as she forces back the tears. HANNA reaches in her pocket for a handkerchief, but only pulls out the letter showed her. The Galinka letter. She sees the address. Galinka, Ostrovska district, Poland. HANNA makes a decision. She is going back to where she wa born. She must find out who she is.
MARISSA enters the apartment. And looks at the chaos. ISA comes up behind her. HENCHMEN at the door.
They had a fight.
She must know the truth.
Where do you think she's gone?
Where would you go? MARISSA turns to ISAACS.
I'm closing the CIA operation down. Heller is dead, that's all that matters to them. This we do alone.

HANNA's head rests on the backrest of a train-seat as the train crawls through the Polish/German border. Exhausted, many nights without sleep. Hungry but unable to eat. Need resolution. In the same carriage a Polish woman sleeps alongside her child of two, also sleeping. HANNA looks at the child. Th peace of the innocent.

The train entering a Polish train station. The town is ca Ostrovska. Freezing cold. The town is in the North of Pol and it's very poor. Industrial. Bleak. HANNA exits, approaches a station guard. 100.
I am looking for a train to Galinka.
Galinka is a small village. No trains. You must wait for bus in the morning.
Where can I stay? He points. HANNA sees the hotel.

HANNA enters the tiny, dank hotel room. She looks at the filthy carpet, the grey ceiling. She turns on the tiny TV Cartoons. Tom and Jerry type stuff. But she doesn't laugh She flicks channel. Then stands dead still. She is lookin ERIK HELLER's dead body on the ground. The report depicts as a dangerous criminal. HANNA stares at the image. The d of the man she spent her life with. Lost forever. HANNA's face oddly still in the TV flicker. Then she flicks it of Leaves the room.

HANNA, exhausted, sleepless and starving, comes down the shabby hotel stairs and enters the hotel bar. Grim. Empty room, old carpet, bad smell, dated pop music. Three hard- drinking men stare at her, making her uncomfortable as sh goes to the bar. A forty-five year old BUSINESSMAN stands there, drinking.
Do you have a sandwich?
Kitchen is closed. The BUSINESSMAN speaks in German.
Get her something. Poor girl's hungry. The barman disappears. HANNA looks round, waits.
I'm from Leipzig. HANNA flinches at the name. Leipzig.
The same.
Business? He looks at her body. HANNA senses it. Her sandwich arriv It's grim. She leaves it, walks out.
Where are you going?
I am tired. I need to sleep. She leaves the bar. HANNA walks back up the stairs. BUSINESSMAN follows.
Hello? She walks along the corridor, gets to her room. BUSINESSM follows.
I was just making nice conversation. Yes? As she enters her room, he puts his foot in the door.
Let's talk. Maybe we can do business. HANNA kicks his foot out of the door. Hard.
You don't like talk, huh? He barges into the room and grabs her. Tries to push her to the bed. He is strong. His words and tone contrasting violently with his actions.

Be nice. Be a nice little dolly. HANNA is thrust on to the bed, but suddenly turns him ove her head and smashes him against a cupboard. BUSINESSMAN grabs her hair and throws her on the bed. But now HANNA snaps. She starts to roar. It's like an ani like nothing we have seen before. She rips at his face, g a glass, smashes it and cuts his face with it. Pure anima rage. BUSINESSMAN starts to scream, blood pouring from hi eyes. He collapses on the floor. She kicks him, punches h repeatedly in a grief-fuelled rage until she is spent of primal fury and falls, panting, to the floor. 102. When she looks up she sees his mangled bloody body lying to her. Not quite dead. HANNA suddenly recoils in horror. Shocked by the viciousn of her actions. Tears begins to run down her cheeks as HANNA grabs the ma wallet, and leaves the room.

Shaking in shock, HANNAH walks out of the hotel and down street, in a daze, no idea where she is going. She starts run, faster and faster, just running to run out of hersel Finally she stops and is sick. She looks up. A taxi's yel light blinks in the darkness. She looks at the businessma wallet to see how much money is in there. She approaches taxi.
I have this much. Can you take me to Galinka?

HANNA is in the taxi as it travels a lonely Polish forest road through undulating snow-covered hills. Cold dawn is arriving. Grey skies lightening through the windscreen. T snowy pines tower above the car. No one else on the road, just a horse drawn cart guiding cows to pasture. It is as from a different age. Quiet, solitary. HANNA checks the paper in her pocket. Still there. Blood on her hands from businessman. A cut in her arm. Carefully, secretly, she w it clean. Suddenly the taxi stops.
This is as far as the money gets you. HANNA looks out. Middle of nowhere.
How much further?
Twelve miles.

Please. But no smile from him, nothing. HANNA gets out. Starts to walk as the taxi turns and drives back the way it came. 103. She is alone in the forest, freezing, shattered, hungry. about dawn. Cold as hell. She hears a car approach. Tries to hail it but it flies p fast. Blows icy air in her face. She continues in the freezing cold - sees the road ahead. It's hilly, winding, she isn't going to make it. Too tire Too shattered. Time passes. Still she walks. Dead on her feet. Gathering every ounce of energy. Then the sounds of another car. But it too just flies by, ignoring her waves and cries. HANNA almost collapses in frustration. But carries on. Carries on walking. Time passes. Freezing cold. HANNA alone on the road. Can make it? Then another car. HANNA turns, waves, cries out. And, alm magically, the car slows and stops. The window winds down
I'm going to Galinka. Can you help me? A woman's voice, German, in German.
Yes I can take you there. And as HANNA gets in, she looks at the comforting, smilin face of MARISSA WIEGLER.
MARISSA starts to drive, HANNA sits in the front with her HANNA has no idea who she is. MARISSA speaks in perfect German. Calm, soft, comforting.
It's a very dull place Galinka. Why would you want to go there?
I was born there. But I've never really seen it. Why are you going?
I have some business to sort out. She looks at her and smiles a sunny, uncomplicated smile. 104.
It's very lucky we ran into each other, don't you think?
Yes...
You've hurt your arm.
It's okay. MARISSA hands her some tissue. HANNA bandages the arm.
I'm Astrid.
You're not German. Are you American?
That's right. I lived there for many years. I travel a lot. MARISSA smiles at her kindly. HANNA feels safe for the fi time in ages. She feels the tears come.
Oh dear, what's wrong with you?
Sorry.
It's okay. Are you in trouble? HANNA nods. She fights the tears. MARISSA gently holds her hand as she drives. HANNA weepin
What sort of trouble?

(though her tears) I don't know what to do. Nothing is what I thought it would be. It's... ugly and cruel and I don't know where to go, or... I'm stupid. I don't know what I expected... MARISSA secretly, genuinely affected by this. Fights the emotion that has surprised her. Human warmth.
Sometimes I feel the same way. 105. HANNA eyes her, surprised to hear this from a grown up wo MARISSA puts on some music. Gentle. Bach maybe.
I like music.

Sleep why don't you? You look very tired. It will take half an hour on this road. HANNA nods. She begins to drift off, so long since she ha slept. Her eyes fall shut and her head rests against the window. She is asleep. Vulnerable.
Soft dawn light as MARISSA drives on a narrow rural road.

MARISSA looks at the sleeping HANNA. MARISSA represses he gathering emotion. HANNA suddenly looking so young as she sleeps the sleep of the innocent. The rush of emotion sho her - she is watching HANNA, not the road - and she veers off, nearly crashing the car, narrowly avoiding a tree. S puts her foot sharply on the brake. She's wearing the sam GREEN SHOES as she wore at Wilhelm's House. HANNA is jolted awake.
Where are we? MARISSA calms herself instantly.
Nearly there. HANNA doesn't see MARISSA'S SHOES.
MARISSA's car slows as it enters a tiny deserted hamlet.
This is it.
HANNA looks around. There is not much to Galinka. She is confused. 106.
It's so small.
Yes. Just a few cottages. And the old bunker. HANNA chooses not to ask any more questions.
Thank you for the ride. You're very kind.
I wish there was more I could do for you. MARISSA looks kindly at HANNA who is confused by the intimacy. MARISSA reaches into the glove compartment and retrieves a torch which she hands to HANNA.
Here, take this. HANNA switches the torch on and off, thinking.
I hope you find what you're looking for.
Thank you. She gets out and shuts the door behind her.

HANNA looks around at the grey desolation, rural poverty, ends of the earth. In the car MARISSA stares at her, then drives off. HANNA walks through the trees along a track. Overgrown, n used for many years. She reaches a hidden entrance off the track. By the entra there is an old battered sign. GALINKA. HANNA looks at th old iron gate. Rusted, locked. It has not been opened in long time. She stares at the sign, tries the gate - yes, locked. The she climbs the gate. She nearly tears her clothes on the spikes at the top of the gate, then leaps over and, exhausted, four days without real sleep, begins to walk u the narrow tree-lined driveway. 107.
HANNA approaches the gaping mouth of an underground bunke She stops, looks down at the torch in her hand, switches on and walks into the darkness.

With only the torch light to see by HANNA treads warily deeper into the tunnels as, behind her, the small apertur daylight recedes slowly to nothing. The tunnels seem to stretch on for miles ahead of her. HANNA reaches a junction where four tunnels meet. She shi her torch down each tunnel, trying to decide which way to She stops when she sees, a little way down one of the tunnels, a child's forgotten shoe. HANNA steps forward and shines her torch down at the tiny shoe, its buckle rusted. She walks on into the dark. HANNA finds a door which she pushes at. The door is stiff but HANNA uses her full weight and soon she's made enough a gap to squeeze through.

At first HANNA has difficulty making out where she is, bu dotted here and there are parts of an old nursery. The wa are painted with a blue sky, clouds and the figures of children holding hands. She begins to remember as, from a distant place, she hear the sound of children laughing. She shines her torch in t direction of the laughter and catches a glimpse of a chil dressed in a party frock and hat, playing hide and seek. shines her torch the other way, and there's another, then third and a fourth. For a moment the room seems to be fil with laughing children. Then, in an instant, they're gone again and silence retur HANNA, lit only be the reflected light of her torch, know she has been here before. She walks on through the tunnels.

HANNA enters a long hall which was once the children's dormitory. 108. At one end is a steep pile of metal bed frames. From a distant place in her memory HANNA begins to hear t sound of children singing.

Happy Birthday to you, Happy Birthday to you... From the far end of the dormitory come a procession of CHILDREN, the first of whom is carrying a large birthday lit with birthday candles. The children's faces glow eeri in the candle light. They're looking at HANNA and walking straight towards her as they sing.
Happy Biirrrrthday, dear... The CHILDREN arrive at HANNA lifting the cake towards her

... Hanna. Happy Birthday to you! HANNA leans forward, takes a deep breath and blows. The children disappear with the flames of the candles. The sound of a woman's approaching footsteps echo through tunnel. HANNA swings her torch beam in the direction of the footsteps. She freezes as she sees a pair of GREEN SHOES walking towards her. The same shoes as in Wilhelm's house MARISSA WIEGLER. HANNA raises her torch beam to see the face of the woman the car.

You're Marissa Wiegler. HANNA starts to shake. MARISSA has her gun pointing at HANNA but her expression the same sunny, uncomplicated smile as earlier. Dead sile HANNA breathing fast. MARISSA speaks in English.
Don't worry sweetie. I don't want to hurt you. MARISSA'S tone has turned into a twisted interpretation o maternal care. HANNA does not move. Like a wild animal cornered. 109.

I could have killed you already when you were asleep in the car. HANNA'S still shaking. HANNA now sees ISAACS and his HENCHMEN, three of them, al with hunting rifles. All ready to shoot her should she at or run. They are some distance away, not coming any close
Did Erik tell you about this place?
Where are the other children? She looks at MARISSA, who waits, then answers quietly.
Sleeping. They're all sleeping.
I don't believe you.
